name: Traject Data System Health Dashboard Wireframe Challenge
description:
Welcome to the **Traject Data System Health Dashboard Wireframe Challenge**! The scope of this challenge is to create interactive wireframes for a desktop application tailored to customers utilizing web scraping products.

This dashboard aims to provide customers with real-time insights into the health and performance of the products they use, by giving information so that customers have more insights on how to interact with the system to get better performance and minimize their wait times by tweaking their behavior when submitting searches. For those that don't have to conduct their searches during peak times they can adjust so they reduce their wait time by going none peak etc.

#### CHALLENGE OBJECTIVES
* Interactive wireframes for a responsive web application
* Address the user’s pain points
* Provide an end to end flow for all interactions as described in the specifications


### ROUND 1
**Submit your initial wireframes for checkpoint review. Feel free to add any screens which are necessary to explain your concept.**

1. Login
2. Status page (logged out) 
3. Status page (logged in)


### ROUND 2
**Submit your final wireframes plus checkpoint feedback implemented. Feel free to add any screens which are necessary to explain your concept.**
1. Sign Up
2. Login
3. Status page (logged out)
4. Status page (logged in)


### CHALLENGE DESCRIPTION

#### APPLICATION OVERVIEW
Our client, Traject Data, offers a range of web scraping products designed to extract data from various websites efficiently. These products include [Rainforest API](https://www.rainforestapi.com/), [Scale SERP](https://www.scaleserp.com/), [ASIN Data API](http://asindataapi.com/), [Value SERP](https://www.valueserp.com/), [BlueCart](https://www.bluecartapi.com/), [Countdown API](https://www.countdownapi.com/), and [SerpWow](https://www.serpwow.com/). To ensure their customers receive optimal value from these products, it is essential to provide them with a centralized platform where they can monitor system health, performance metrics, and receive actionable recommendations.  

Here are some examples of what these APIs do:
* Rainforest APIs = it’s a tool that can grab any piece of information from Amazon’s product listings that you might need like for example product pricing, special offers, discounts, reviewers, etc.
* Scale SER = provides a Search Engine Results Page (SERP) API service. It's designed for developers and businesses that need to automate the retrieval of search engine data at scale.

The scope of this challenge is to replace the Status page/ System Health Dashboard with something more tailored for each customer.

The Status page already exists both in [logged out mode](https://rainforestapi.statuspage.io/), can be accessed from [top navigation](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ifufzoy1tmRTEyFg5lONzbYotK5UZ-BB/view?usp=drive_link) and in [logged in mode](https://rainforestapi.statuspage.io/) where it can be accessed from the [left side menu](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11wnw04zRfieW7hZsfgR8O0gO_Jpa9usH/view?usp=drive_link). Note that they both look the same now. Feel free to create a demo account to get a better understanding of the products. In this challenge, we will improve both pages with data that is more valuable to users.

The Status page / System Health Dashboard serves as a customized portal for customers to monitor the performance and health of the web scraping products they use. It aims to provide insights into system uptime, peak traffic times, feature enhancements, bug fixes, and system limitations.

The System Health Dashboard will cover the following key areas:
* Health State Metrics
* Peak Traffic Times
* Feature Enhancements.
* Bug Fixes
* System Limitations

The System Health Dashboard is inspired by the Disneyland fast pass system.  It should have enough information to guide their user behavior on how they can most effectively interact with the system to minimize wait times for users accessing the system during peak traffic periods.


#### AUDIENCE
User Role:
* Software engineer
* Works within an e-commerce company's product team. His company has high data consumption needs.
* Age: 27 years old.
* Programming experience:High, with understanding of APIs and data analysis tools.
* Requires tools for competitive analysis, market trend tracking, and product performance evaluation.


#### PERSONA
* Name: Jordan Smith
* Occupation: Software engineer
* Goals:
			* Compile comprehensive data on competitive products available on Amazon, including pricing, reviews, and bestseller rankings.
			* Analyze market trends and consumer preferences to guide product development and marketing strategies.
			* Schedule tasks during off-peak hours to receive priority processing
			* Get emails notifications when a task has been completed
* Frustrations:
			* Difficulty in gathering and updating large volumes of product data manually from Amazon.
			* Has a hard time finding easy to understand documentation 
			* Existing tools do not provide the depth or reliability of data needed for thorough analysis.
			* Not knowing when to access the system to run a task or see when a specific task has been completed
* Wants:
			* A robust, scalable API that can handle extensive Amazon product data collection and updating tasks with minimal oversight.
			* A  way to know the best times to access the system 
			* An easy way to understand documentation and parsed data for consumption
			* A way to search on different levels and get an estimation of the waiting times
			* To get notified on tasks completion per email 


#### SCENARIO
Jordan is tasked with monitoring a range of products similar to their company’s offerings on Amazon to identify trends in consumer preferences and competitive pricing strategies. They need to track changes in customer reviews and ratings, monitor pricing adjustments by competitors, and identify top-selling products in relevant categories. However, manually tracking this information is time-consuming and prone to error, making it difficult to respond quickly to market changes.

By leveraging Traject Data, Jordan hopes to automate the data collection process, ensuring real-time updates and comprehensive coverage of relevant products on Amazon. This would enable them to provide actionable insights to the product development and marketing teams, helping the company to stay competitive and responsive to consumer trends.

One of the most used pages for Jordan is the Status page, which shows the system health dashboard of the products he uses (Rainforest API, Scale SERP, Cyfe). This page gives him health state metrics such as uptime, response times, network latency etc. but also information on peak traffic time so he knows how to plan his activity for better performance which is exactly what he’s looking for. In addition, he gets an email notification when his task completed and he can check it.

#### GLOSSARY
**Web scraping products** = are tools designed to automatically extract data from websites. They navigate the internet and have the purpose of collecting specific information quickly and efficiently from various web pages. The information can be product prices, stock levels, contact information or even entire articles, which then the businesses uses the results to make informed decisions.

**Schedule a task** =  telling the system when to do a task, like gathering data from websites, at times when it's not too busy to avoid waiting (the task is scheduled in the future). On Traject Data website, this is referred as batches or collections.

**System Health Dashboard** = Status page that monitors the performance of user’s products

##### SCREENS / FEATURES REQUIRED
The customer website for Rainforest API is here: https://www.rainforestapi.com/ For the purpose of this challenge, we will focus on the Status page / System Health Dashboard in the logged out and logged in mode. You don’t need to touch any of the other pages from the navigation like Product, Documentation, etc (external) or Collections, Destinations (internal ones). Just focus on the screens listed below:

##### 1. Sign Up Screen
A user should be able to create an account on rainforestapi.com . The client already has an [existing sign up page](https://app.rainforestapi.com/signup), but they would like to improve it .
The page would include a form to fill with following fields:
* First name
* Last name
* Email
* Company name
* Expected monthly volume (selection)
* Industry (selection)
* Password
* Password confirmation
* Button to start trial (uses have free 100 requests)


#### 2. Login Screen
If a user has an account, they would come to this page to log in. Authentication will ensure that each user sees only the information relevant to the products they have subscribed to.
The client already has an [existing log in page](https://app.rainforestapi.com/login), but they would like to improve it .
Things to include:
* Email
* Password
* Button to login


#### 3. Status Screen (Logged Out)
To see the current status page, go to https://rainforestapi.statuspage.io/ Right now the page uses Atlasian for displaying data but we now wish to show more useful information. Do not change anything else in the navigation. 

This page is going to address potential customers without a login to the system and should provide high level status by product with the following information for each:
* Last Modified (ie month, week ago)
* Last Tested (ie hours, min ago)
* Used (number of time(s))
* Used by (number of user(s))
* Total Records Processed: This is the overarching metric showing the total number of records processed by your data scraping operation. 

All the data above is going to be shown realtime.

The Traject Data’s products are: Rainforest API, Scale SERP, Cyfe, ASIN Data API, SERP API, Value SERP, BlueCart, Countdown API, SerpWow, and AuthorityLabs.

Feel free to use different representations for this like a card or list view etc. or suggest other ideas on how best to show the metrics above for all the 10 products.
Email Notifications are also needed:
1. The system will have the capability for users to subscribe to email notifications.
2. Users can add multiple email addresses to receive alerts and updates regarding system health and performance.
3. Show how signing up for email notifications looks

Think of other features you can add to improve this page. Some ideas:
* Show if there is any critical issue affecting one product and if yes, which product is affected
* FAQ/ Help section: a small area where users can get more information about what themetrics mean and why they are important
* A button for visitors to sign up to start using the products
* A “Contact Us” button for visitors to reach out with questions or bugs
* What are other things you can suggest to improve the user experience for the visitors to understand the metrics and encourage them to sign up to use the products?


#### 4. Status Screen (Logged In)
Users will log in using their credentials to access the Status page/  System Health Dashboard. The page will live under Status menu on this [screenshot](https://drive.google.com/file/d/11wnw04zRfieW7hZsfgR8O0gO_Jpa9usH/view?usp=sharing). Do not change any of the other elements in the navigation.

Upon login, users will be presented with a personalized status page tailored to the products they have subscribed to. When planning this page, think that the user might be using 1 product or 10 products or anywhere in between, so think of a layout that makes content easy to scan in both cases. We would like to see how the page looks in empty state as well as with many products.

**Note:**  We need to see 2 versions of this pages - one that has a separate page per product, as initially the each product will have its own status page incorporated and then we want to see a status page for all products consolidated into one page, because in the future development, all products will have one login only.

The status page will provide an overview of system health metrics, peak traffic times, and feature updates and others specific to the user's selected products.  All the information displayed is shown in realtime.
The page will include the following information for each product the customer has:
* Generic Data (that exists under Status page in logged out mode too)
					* Last Modified (ie month, week ago)
					* Last Tested (ie hours, min ago)
					* Used (number of time(s))
					* Used by (number of user(s))
					* Total Records Processed: This is the overarching metric showing the total number of records processed by your data scraping operation. 

* Unique Data (that can be found only when a user is logged, specific to his products only). Note: the data below can be a representation of graphs, text, visuals to show related information in the best way possible:
**1.Health State Metrics:**
* Real-time monitoring of system health, including uptime, response times, error rates, saturation capacity, and network latency.
*** Daily/Weekly/Monthly Processing Rate:** Break down the total number of records processed into daily, weekly, or monthly rates to illustrate the consistency and scale of your scraping activities. (ex show how many records are processed per day on average)
* **Peak Processing Rate:** Highlight the highest rate of records processed per unit of time(daily, weekly, or monthly). This is meant to showcase our system's capacity to handle large volumes of data during peak periods.
* **Data Processing Efficiency:** Calculate metrics such as records processed per unit of time (daily, weekly, or monthly) or per computational resource (e.g., records processed per server or per core). This demonstrates the efficiency of your data processing infrastructure.
* **Data Processing Errors or Failures:** While not directly related to the volume of records processed, tracking the number or percentage of processing errors or failures provides insight into the reliability of your scraping operation. Low error rates indicate a robust and well-maintained system.
* **Data Volume Trends Over Time:** Plot the volume of records processed over time to identify trends and patterns. This can help forecast future processing requirements and detect any anomalies or changes in data volume.
* **Comparison to Previous Periods**: Compare the current volume of records processed to previous periods (e.g., month-over-month or year-over-year comparisons). This highlights growth or changes in data processing activities over time.
* **Geographic Distribution of Data:** If applicable, showcase the geographic distribution of the data processed. This can be useful for understanding regional variations in data availability or demand. Think of showing areas with higher concentrations of data points and areas with less data. 
* **Customer Impact:** If the processed data is used by customers or stakeholders, quantify the impact of the data in terms of business insights, revenue generation, cost savings, or other relevant metrics.
				* Business Insights: Mention how the data led to new discoveries or decisions that positively affected the business. For example, a chart showing a significant increase in customer engagement following a marketing strategy adjustment based on data insights.
				* Revenue Generation: Provide graphs or figures that illustrate revenue growth directly tied to the use of processed data. For instance, a line graph showing steady revenue increase after implementing data-driven product recommendations on a retail site.
				* Cost Savings: Show data or charts that demonstrate cost reductions achieved through efficiencies or optimizations informed by data. A bar chart could compare operational costs before and after the adoption of a data-driven logistics optimization.
* Based on the above data suggest what actionable recommendations can the system provide to the user
**IMPORTANT: think of what are the other metrics we could show to highlight the speed, reliability and complexity of what our customer offers.**
* **Note**: Traject Data can do multilevel searches so primary search can take 10 seconds, secondary search can take 20 seconds etc, tertiary search can take 30 seconds. It all depends on the level of detail needed. How can we show this in the metrics area?


**2. Feature Enhancements:** Highlighting recent enhancements and updates specific to the products used by the customer.
**3. Bug Fixes:** Notifying customers of recent bug fixes and improvements to ensure a smoother user experience.
**4. System Limitations**: Providing insights into any limitations or constraints within the system to manage user expectations effectively. This could be performance caps of maximum processing speeds, how much data can be handled at a time or resource constraints such as memory usage and network bandwidth.

When you use graphs and visuals etc., make sure to show any interactions as needed.
 
Other functionality that should be included on this screen: 
**A. Users will have the option to schedule tasks** or access the system during off-peak hours to receive priority processing. During these "off-peak" periods, there's less competition for processing power, which means tasks can be completed more quickly and efficiently. Users who choose to run their tasks during these times might experience faster processing and possibly even prioritization over tasks submitted during busier periods.
**B. The system will analyze historical traffic patterns to predict optimal times** for users to access the system with minimal wait times.
*  Future requirement (one button to schedule a batch job in the future to leverage batch job or collections depending on the product)
*  Allow for users to be able to trigger recording logs when they encounter an issue. 
			* User case is that a user is trying to execute a job either real time or batched.  They run into an issue.  When they encounter enough they go to the System Health Dashboard either click a button or trigger a way for them to execute the job again.  As a result of that triggered event logs are then records for the engineering team to be able to use that to diagnose issues quickly without having to interact with a Customer Service Rep to manually gather this information from the customer.

**C. Users will receive notifications or prompts suggesting the best times** to access the system based on their preferences and workload.


**D. Email Notifications:**
1. The system will have the capability for users to subscribe to email notifications.
2. Users can add multiple email addresses to receive alerts and updates regarding system health and performance.
3. Show how signing up for email notifications looks

**E. Real-time Notifications**
1. Notifications regarding system health, feature updates, bug fixes, and peak traffic times will be displayed near real-time within this page. This can be a section on this page. The user should be able to see a notification’s detail as well and which product is affected and how.
2. Users will receive immediate alerts on any critical issues affecting system performance both on this screen and per email

Other potential features to add:
* Have a button to launch a task (no need to show the flow here)
* Show if there is any critical issue affecting one of my products and if yes, which product is affected
* FAQ/ Help section: a small area where users can get more information about what themetrics mean and why they are important
* A button for visitors to sign up to start using the products
* A “Contact Us” button for visitors to reach out with questions or bugs


#### JUDGEMENT CRITERIA
* **Presentation**: Thorough: provide a thorough wireframe solution. It should simulate the workflow described, including linked screens, variations and behaviors of elements.
* **Creativity**: Impactful: the solution is different or unique from what is already out there and can be implemented.
* **Exploration**: Out of the box: consider the screen requirements and guidelines as a draft or start point. Provide alternate experiences or workflows to achieve what we are proposing in the requirements and satisfy the user goals.
* **Aesthetics**: Low-fidelity design: provide plain simple aesthetics within a detailed wireframe solution.
* **Branding**: Open: Your solution MUST be pure wireframes without the use of branding or styling of UI elements. Focus is on content and functionality. 

#### DEVICE SPECIFICATIONS
* Web:  1366 x 768 (width x height)

#### STOCK ART
* Photos: Use only free photos from the [sites allowed by Topcoder](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/stock-artwork-font-and-icon-policies)
* Icons: Use only icons that are free (based on [Topcoder icons policy](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/stock-artwork-font-and-icon-policies)) without giving attribution, or create the icons yourself. If the icons are not free, we will require them to be replaced in the final fixes.
* Fonts: Use fonts as allowed by [Topcoder policy](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/stock-artwork-font-and-icon-policies)

#### MARVEL PROTOTYPE
* Upload your screens to Marvel App.
* Ask in the forums for a Marvel project
* Include your Marvel app URL as a text file in your final submission. Label it “MarvelApp URL”.
* Note: even if you use Figma or other tool with prototyping functionality except Axure, you should request a Marvel project for this challenge

#### FINAL DELIVERABLES
* An archive called Source.zip file to include:
			* All original source files created with a wireframe tool such as: Axure, Adobe XD, Figma or Sketch. 
* An archive called Submission.zip file to include:
			* All your wireframes in html format or PNG / JPG format
* Your declaration files to include any notes about fonts usage, photo and icon declaration and link to your Marvel project
* Create a JPG preview file of 1024 x 1024 px

name: Innovation Series - Challenge 4: IntelliCase Bot (GPT)
description:
In this challenge, contestants will develop a conversational chatbot using GPT technology to effectively search, analyze, and present Topcoder case studies to sales and website visitors. The chatbot should be able to infer the nuances of user inquiries, identify relevant case studies **even when keywords don't match exactly**, and provide insightful responses beyond mere keyword matching. 

Topcoder previously hosted a challenge that utilized open-source offline large language models (LLMs) such as Mistral and Llama2, which you can explore in detail at this [link](https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/473d2563-9378-460d-b898-c894f39df706?tab=details). In this challenge, however, contestants are free to solve the problem using any available online LLMs. 

In addition, the winner of this challenge will be invited to a Talent-On-Demand engagement to build a solution for the [OpenAI store](https://openai.com/blog/introducing-the-gpt-store), for additional payment.

### Challenge Objective

The goal of this project is to develop an LLM-powered conversational chatbot that can:
* Effectively search and retrieve relevant Topcoder case studies based on user inquiries.
* Infer the nuances of user inquiries, even when keywords don't match exactly.
* Provide insightful responses that go beyond mere keyword matching, including personalized recommendations and contextual insights.
* Accurately explain Topcoder capabilities conversationally, combining the case studies provided to this challenge and avoid hallucination.



**Register for additional information.**

discussions.name: Innovation Series 4: IntelliCase Bot (GPT) Discussion

name: Development of Generative AI Moderator for Trusted Web3 Community
description:
Welcome to the "Development of Generative AI Moderator for Trusted Web3 Community” challenge, sponsored by Fujitsu and TC3!

This challenge aims to create a safe and trusted society and community by developing a communication support function that protects social media posters and improves the community. Building a trustworthy community on social media is an important factor, but online communication has various challenges. There is potential to solve these issues with the support of AI technology. To this end, we seek to harness the capabilities of the rapidly developing Large Language Models (LLM) to power an AI moderator that analyzes social media content. If any problems are detected, the system will proactively warn or advise the poster, thus addressing these issues. As a first step, we will conduct an ideation and development challenge to design new perspectives for analyzing social media posts and develop the program necessary to perform this analysis.

This challenge is the third installment of the [Web3 × AI Innovation Challenge series](https://join.topcoder.com/fujitsu), hosted by Fujitsu.

**Important Notes:**
Please note that participation may be subject to certain geographic restrictions, detailed further below in this document.
# Background
## 2.1 Fujitsu stands with Web3 and AI
The World Economic Forum's Annual Meeting 2023 theme "Cooperation in a Fragmented World" drew attention as a sign of the transition to a decentralized structure. In response to these changes, Fujitsu has developed multiple Web3 technology based systems.
Furthermore, we believe that the evolution of Web3 and AI can help to address the negative aspects that have been brought by ICT technology and play a key role in the creation of a new social economy.

Fujitsu is a strong advocate for open innovation with a history of commitment to the concept.
In the Web3 and AI field, Fujitsu provides 2 platforms to accelerate open innovation: the “Fujitsu Research Portal” and “Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform”.

## 2.2 Fujitsu and Federated Social Networking Service(Federated SNS)
### Fujitsu's Vision
* Fujitsu is promoting activities around the Web3 Acceleration Platform (AP) to accelerate the societal implementation of Web3 by allowing for various app developments to be tried and tested. However, a new challenge identified through activities on the Web3 AP is how to invigorate collaboration among users and organizations.
* To address this issue, we are exploring a method that combines decentralized social networking services (SNS) that allow for easy communication between self-sovereign organizations with AI agents that can foster community activities aligned with participants' goals.
* Through this approach, it becomes possible for agents and humans to collaborate on social networks, and we aim to realize a world where humans and AI agents autonomously interact, nurturing human networks, and promoting effective activities in cooperation with others according to individual objectives.
### Federated SNS
* Decentralized social networking services like Bluesky are characterized by their non-centralized nature. Unlike platforms such as X or Facebook that are controlled by a single organizational entity responsible for data management and order maintenance, these are managed and operated by the community as a whole.
* As an implementation of decentralized SNS, there is the AT Protocol provided by Bluesky as open-source software (OSS), and Fujitsu is developing an SNS that extends this protocol. Fujitsu is utilizing its own technology to innovate and improve upon its unique Federated SNS.
### The Need for AI Moderators
* Online communities, including social networking services (SNS), come with several communication challenges. For example, unpleasant or harmful posts can negatively affect other users, or unintended leakage of personal information may occur due to inferences drawn from post content, victimizing the poster.
* One approach to solving these challenges is through content moderation, which involves monitoring and managing post content to maintain order within the community. This could mean deleting offensive content or alerting users about the risk of personal information leakage before they post.
* Content moderation often requires nuanced judgment that has traditionally been performed by humans. However, the task of continuously monitoring for offensive content can cause significant mental strain for content moderators. For instance, there have been reports of Facebook moderators developing PTSD-like symptoms due to their work conditions. (Reference: https://www.theverge.com/2019/2/25/18229714/cognizant-facebook-content-moderator-interviews-trauma-working-conditions-arizona)
* Therefore, reducing the burden on content moderators is an essential issue that necessitates the development of automatic systems capable of making highly accurate determinations.
## 2.3 Introduction of Fujitsu Research Portal
The [Fujitsu Research Portal](https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/) is an environment that gives users the ability to quickly test Fujitsu’s technologies by providing APIs and web applications of tech components for free.
We're delighted to invite Topcoder members to take part in the [Fujitsu Research Portal](https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/) — an innovative platform that grants access to Fujitsu's cutting-edge Web3 and AI technologies.

For this Challenge, we will be using Fujitsu's Federated SNS to acquire data. The Federated SNS can be accessed through the Fujitsu Research Portal.
In addition to this challenge, we hope you will find the technologies and resources available on the Fujitsu Research Portal to be valuable for exploring your ideas.
We also welcome your feedback on the Fujitsu Research Portal so that we can continue to improve it.
Let's start having fun with the Fujitsu Research Portal!

name: CRCBoost App - Figma Design Updates Challenge
description:
Welcome to "**CRCBoost App - Figma Design Updates Challenge**". In this challenge, we need your help to create several new screens for our CRCBoost apps. We need these screens fast and we need it to be responsive as well! Existing screens and the Figma file will be shared so you don't have to start from scratch. It also will give you a quick understanding about the styles and type of user interface that we are looking for!

Read the challenge specification carefully and watch the forums for any questions or feedback concerning this challenge. Let us know if you have any questions in the challenge forum!
# 
### BACKGROUND OVERVIEW
* A responsive AI-powered web application that supports web, mobile, and tablet aimed at enhancing public safety through advanced incident and event reporting capabilities.
# 
### CHALLENGE OBJECTIVES
* Create new screens for our CRCBoost apps that aligned and match with our branding and fulfil the purpose of the required features 
* Create design for 2 new responsive pages and it’s interactions
* Important! Your design needs to be responsive for Web/Desktop, Tablet, and Mobile
# 
### TARGET AUDIENCES
* Admin User
* Officer
* Lead
# 
### TARGET DEVICES
* Web/Desktop application: 975 px width x 1378 px height 
* Tablet (Portrait): 834 px width x 1194 px height 
* Mobile (Portrait): 407 px width x 876 px height
# 
### DOCUMENTATION
* [Existing Figma File](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JSbbj46xAbzIA2Blw8qP-6LoDO8X0UIt/view?usp=sharing)
* [Persona Use Case](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AxqpT1xB-pnAe7E6h5t9QWmqSNebI2X8/view?usp=sharing)
# 
### SCREEN REQUIREMENTS
**00) General design**
* We need some design that can be re-usable: 
  * Modal window design that can be reusable later, for example: confirmation from the user before performing any action like Save, Cancel, Submit, etc
  * Error messages design - login, credential standard not met, any external issues
  * Common tooltip design reusable design - As when required, developers can add to required input fields/menus.
  * Common Processing animation icon to indicate to the user the application progressing in the backend.
# 
**01) User management module screen**
* This screen will be use by Admin user only
* Add button or navigation where Admin can add new user
* We need to have summary cards in this screen, something to show information about total active users, active officers, active leads, etc
* Create a table to list all the users, keep it simple and responsive. You are free to create alternative design for the user lists (thumbnail, cards, etc), but table is required in this page
* List all the users and their details to view and edit:
  * First Name
  * Last Name
  * User ID
  * EmailId 
  * Role: Admin/Officer/Lead
  * Status: Active/Inactive
* Search option for all the above fields
* Pagination option
* Option to Save/cancel the changes
* Ability to edit/delete/etc the users needs to be added as well
* Confirmation/Prompts modal window before save or cancel
# 
**02) Report management module screen**
* This screen will be use by Lead user only
* This needs to be created as a dashboard for the lead user.
* When lead user login and open the platform, he need to see a one or multiple dashboards which:
  * Will show the total no of incidents reported by all the officers
  * Need to show the status of those tickets
  * Officer wise dashboard -> where Lead user can navigate or select a user and go through the User’s reported incidents with status
* We also need a section for viewing all the reports so it’s not just the total/summary shown. Report is a collection of all incidents that comes from one incident and the follow up by one officer or more. This area is only for view mode, no option to edit:
  * User Action: The Lead user chooses to generate a log report, typically by clicking on a designated 'Generate Report' button or menu option.
  * Report Content: The generated report contains all log entries made by the Officer on the chosen date 
  * Report Structure: A standardised header with static text, and the main body listing the Officer's log entries, including the status of each entry
  * Status Indication: Each log entry's status (e.g., whether the tour duty is complete) is displayed.
  * Modification Restrictions: The report at this stage is for viewing only; no modifications are allowed.
  * Option to download the report page as PDF
# 
### BRANDING GUIDELINES
* Your design MUST follow our existing design style in Figma files that we provided
# 
### DESIGN PROTOTYPE
* We need you to create figma prototype to showcase your design with client
* Include your figma prototype link in declaration files 
# 
### JUDGING CRITERIA
* Creativity: Impactful - the solution is different or unique from what is already out there and can be implemented
* Exploration: Flexible - follow the provided screen requirements section and propose improvements or different paths that positively impact the user goals
* Aesthetics: Hi-fidelity design - provide a top-notch finished-looking visual design
* Branding: Strict - carefully follow the provided guidelines and stick to them.
# 
### FINAL DELIVERABLES
* An archive called Source.zip file to include:
  * All original source files created with Figma (note: you need to include the local ".FIG" source file and not just the link to your file in figma cloud)
  * A folder called "submission" file that include all your images in PNG / JPG format
  * Your declaration files to include any notes about fonts usage, photo and icon declaration and link to your Figma prototype
# 
### FINAL FIXES
* As part of the final fixes phase, you may be asked to modify design, content, or user click paths

name: Marathon Match 152
description:
## Important Links

-   [Submission-Review](https://submission-review.topcoder.com/) You can find your submissions *artifacts* here. Artifacts will contain output.txt's for both example test cases and provisional test cases with stdout/stderr and individual test case scores. 
-   [Other Details](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/marathon-processor-specification-and-scoring-terminology) For other details like Processing Server Specifications, Submission Queue, Example Test Cases Execution.

## Overview

You are an artist specialising in abstract paintings. You start with a blank **H\*W** canvas and paint a series of rectangles, each using one of **C** colours. Rectangles can be painted on top of existing rectangles in which case the new colour will override the previous colour. Rectangles must be parallel to the axes. The cost of painting a $h \times w$ rectangle is $\sqrt{hw}$. Your task is to draw a given **target** painting with the minimal cost.

Here is an example solution for seed=76. Initially the canvas is blank (white). Each move paints a rectangle of a particular colour and location. The target colours of each cell are shown as small circles.

![seed76.gif](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/mzzOAobQyit9LenupBOi)


## Input and Output

Your code will receive as input the following values, each on a separate line:

-  **H**, the height of the canvas.
-  **W**, the width of the canvas
-  **C**, the number of colours.
-  **H\*W** lines representing the **target** grid in row-major order. Each cell will be a colour between **1** and **C**, inclusive. The top-left corner is $(0, 0)$, while the bottom-right corner is $(H-1, W-1)$.

You must output a sequence of moves, formatted as follows:

- **N**, number of moves.
- **N** lines representing the moves. Each move must be formated as "$r_1$ $c_1$ $r_2$ $c_2$ col" (without the quotes), where $(r_1, c_1)$ is the location of the top-left corner of the rectangle, $(r_2, c_2)$ is the location of its bottom-right corner and *col* is the colour to paint it in. The following must hold $0 \leq r_1 \leq r_2 \leq H-1$ and $0 \leq c_1 \leq c_2 \leq W-1$. The cost of such rectangle is $\sqrt{(r_2-r_1+1)(c_2-c_1+1)}$.


## Scoring

The raw score is the cost of all your rectangles. If your return was invalid, then your raw score on this test case will be -1. Possible reasons include:

- Using more than **H\*W\*C** moves.
- Using invalid formatting of moves.
- Using locations that lie outside the grid.
- Leaving a cell unpainted or painting it in the wrong colour.
- Exceeding the time limit. 

If your raw score for a test case is negative then your normalized score for that test case is 0. Otherwise, your normalized score for each test case is MIN/YOUR, where YOUR is your raw score and MIN is the smallest positive raw score currently obtained on this test case (considering only the last submission from each competitor). Finally, the sum of all your test scores is normalized to 100.


## Test Case Generation

Please look at the generate() method in the visualizer's source code for the exact details about test case generation. Each test case is generated as follows:

- The height of the canvas **H** is chosen between **10** and **50**, inclusive.
- The width of the canvas **W** is chosen between **10** and **50**, inclusive.
- The number of colours **C** is chosen between **2** and **7**, inclusive.
- Generate the **target** grid. Start with a blank grid. Select two opposite corners of a rectangle at random. If the area of the selected rectangle is less than $H*W/20$ then paint it with a random colour between **1** and **C**, inclusive; otherwise repeat the selection of the rectangle. This process is continued until every cell has been painted.
- All values are chosen uniformly at random.


## Notes

-   The time limit is **10** seconds per test case (this includes only the time spent in your code). The memory limit is **1024** megabytes.
-   The compilation time limit is **30** seconds.
-   There are **10** example test cases and **100** full submission (provisional) test cases. There will be **2000** test cases in the final testing.
-   The match is rated.

## Languages Supported

C#, Java, C++ and Python

## Submission Format

Your submission must be a single ZIP file not larger than 500 MB, with your source code only. 
Please Note: Please zip only the file. Do not put it inside a folder before zipping, you should directly zip the file.

Make sure you name your Source Code file as AbstractArt*.<appropriate extension>* 

### Sample Submissions

Here are example solutions for different languages, modified to be executed with the visualizer. You may modify and submit these example solutions:

-   Java Source Code - [AbstractArt.java.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/jsWJu5HPTxCk1tkNdVM1)
-   C++ Source Code - [AbstractArt.cpp.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/3QoLAFP5S5qYPva044fq)
-   Python3.6 Source Code - [AbstractArt.py.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/jmrr9BLQDWKtyFlJ4uQQ)
-   C# Source Code - [AbstractArt.cs.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/L7hQAXQIQgOvgsNUbymm)

## Tools

An offline tester is available below. You can use it to test/debug your solution locally. You can also check its source code for an exact implementation of test case generation and score calculation. You can also find links to useful information and sample solutions in several languages.

#### Downloads

- Visualizer Source - [AbstractArtTester.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/pArdGitR5y0LQb7lQBPs)
- Visualizer Binary - [tester.jar.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/aeLaiOegQfqhyWfce9ig)

#### Offline Tester / Visualizer

Your solution should interact with the tester/visualizer by reading data from standard input and writing data to standard output. 
  
To run the tester with your solution, you should run: 
  
**java -jar tester.jar -exec "<command>" -seed <seed>** 
  
Here, <command> is the command to execute your program, and <seed> is seed for test case generation. 
If your compiled solution is an executable file, the command will be the full path to it, for example, "C:\\TopCoder\\AbstractArt.exe" or "~/topcoder/AbstractArt". 
In case your compiled solution is to be run with the help of an interpreter, for example, if your program is in Java, the command will be something like "java -cp C:\\TopCoder AbstractArt". 
  
Additionally you can use the following options:

-   **\-seed** <seed> Sets the seed used for test case generation, default is seed 1.
-   **\-debug**. Print debug information.
-   **\-novis**. Turns off visualisation.
-   **\-noanimate**. Turns off animation and only displays the final state.
-   **\-pause**. Starts the visualizer in paused mode. See more information below.
-   **\-delay** <delay> Sets the delay (in milliseconds) between visualizing consecutive simulation steps, default is 1000.
-   **\-showDots**. Shows the target colours as circles. This mode is automatically selected in the manual mode, see below.
-   **\-manual**. Paint the canvas manually. Use keys **1** to **C**, to select the colour. The selected colour will be displayed below the grid. The first left click selects the top-left corner of the rectangle, while the second left click selects its bottom-right corner, and paints the rectangle in the chosen colour. Use right click to undo the move.
-   **\-H** <H> Sets a custom canvas height.
-   **\-W** <W> Sets a custom canvas width.
-   **\-C** <C> Sets a custom number of colours.


The visualizer works in two modes. In regular mode, steps are visualized one after another with a delay specified with the -delay parameter. In paused mode, the next move will be visualized only when you press any key. The space key can be used to switch between regular and paused modes. The default starting mode is regular. You can use the -pause parameter to start in paused mode.
 
Marathon local testers have many useful options, including running a range of seeds with a single command, running more than one seed at time (multiple threads), controlling time limit, saving input/output/error and loading solution from a file. The usage of these options are described [here](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/marathon-local-tester-parameters).

name: Innovation Series - Challenge 3: Lab45 LLM Expert Hackathon
description:
Generative AI significantly improves workplace efficiency through advanced data analysis techniques. This challenge focuses on using Large Language Models (LLMs) to interpret tabular data, providing clear and meaningful conclusions.


## Challenge Objective and Instructions
You must develop an LLM-based solution that can answer questions about events.  Specifically, develop an LLM-based solution that:

* Ingests tabular data from a CSV file that will be provided when the Submission phase begins.
* The file includes the data you will need, along with every question you will be asked.  For a small number of questions, answers are also provided. 
* For each question posed in the data file, compute a natural language answer based on the information provided with the question. There is one question per row in the file.
* Record your answer to the solutions.csv  for every question, and make sure your answer corresponds to the correct question.

**Key Constraints:**

* Solutions can use commercial LLM APIs (e.g., OpenAI, VertexAI, AWS Falcon).Topcoder holds a license for OpenAI.
* Solutions can also be based on publicly available LLMs.
* The challenge focuses on zero-shot learning; no specific training data will be provided.
* Contestants are not allowed to use LLM based APIs which have functionality which is customized for tabular data understanding example - LlamaParse (https://github.com/run-llama/llama_parse).
* Contestants are expected to build the tabular data understanding grounds up based on a single LLM.

**Note:** 
* Challenge Submission Start Date : **10th April, 2024**
* Challenge Submission End Date : **15th April, 2024**
* The provisional test data will be made available to the participants, once the challenge is open for submissions and the hold back test data will be made available, a day before the challenge ends in forums


## Evaluation

This challenge offers provisional and final testing rounds. Submissions will be evaluated on performance, technical merits, and documentation.
Performance will be  measured using BERTScore, an ML-based metric designed to assess the quality of responses to questions.

**Provisional Testing:**  
* Provisional test data and queries will be shared in the forums at the start the submission phase.
* Contestants must submit their solution.csv file (see below for instructions) during the submission phase. 
* Topcoder will assign a Provisional Score to your submission by computing the average of the BERTScore calculations for each response.  
* The leaderboard will be updated periodically with your score.
* Code will not be evaluated during the Provisional round/submission period.

**Final Testing**: 
* Hold-back test data and queries will be shared in forums 24 hours before the submission phase ends.
* The final submission package has to include responses for this hold-back test data in the final-solution.csv file.
* Topcoder will make one attempt to run your code.  If your code doesn’t run, your submission will be disqualified.  Topcoder may but is not required to ask you for clarifications while running your code.
* Final scores will be calculated as Score = 0.7*( BERTScore Average) + 0.3*(Code Quality and Documentation).
* Scores will be ranked from highest to lowest to determine prize positions.


## Submission

**This challenge uses the code submission style. Your submission must include the following items.**
* The codebase for the solution:
* A video showcasing the setup and results of the first five questions in the hold-back test data. If the submission zip file including video is greater than 250 MB, upload it as an Unlisted video on YouTube and include the link in your documentation file.
* A deployment instruction about how to install required libs and how to run.
* A Docker file must be included for easy deployment.
* A starter bash script that we can boot up the service from the command line easily.
* Clear inline comments are strongly recommended for the key steps.
* A report about your solution, including the chosen LLM, architecture, etc.


**The final submission zip file should be in below format.**
```
submission.zip
....code/
........[YOUR CODEBASE HERE]
....solution/
........solution.csv
........final-solution.csv
....documentation/ (Hold-back test data execution video and solution report in pdf format)
```


## General Notes

* This challenge is not rated.
* Teaming is not permitted.
* Use the match forum to ask general questions or report problems, but please do not post comments and questions that reveal information about the problem itself or possible solution techniques.
* In this match you may use any programming language and libraries, provided Topcoder is able to run it free of any charge. You may also use any open-source languages and libraries, with the restrictions listed in the next section below. If your solution requires licenses, you must have these licenses and be able to legally install them in a testing VM etc.
* Prior to submission, please make absolutely sure your submission can be run by Topcoder free of cost, and with all necessary licenses pre-installed in your solution. Topcoder is not required to contact submitters.
* You may use open source languages and libraries provided they are equally free for your use, use by another competitor, or use by the client.
* If your solution includes licensed elements (software, data, programming language, etc) make sure that all such elements are covered by licenses that explicitly allow commercial use.
* If your solution includes licensed software (e.g. commercial software, open source software, etc), you must include the full license agreements with your submission. Include your licenses in a folder labeled “Licenses”. Within the same folder, include a text file labeled “README” that explains the purpose of each licensed software package as it is used in your solution.


## Referral Program

Earn $500 when you participate in this Innovation Challenge and successfully refer a friend to their first gig. 

**How do I do it?**

It’s simple!. 

1. Go to this [gig](https://www.topcoder.com/gigs/17025590959730013350elx). 
2. Make sure you’re logged in to Topcoder.  
3. On the [gig page](https://www.topcoder.com/gigs/17025590959730013350elx), you’ll see a referral panel that looks like this:

![image.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/bExoCEFTza5NQzSDmQSE)

4. Enter an email of a someone that you think would be a good fit and interesting in working on future GenAI related gigs OR simply share your Referral Link with them.
5. You’re done! If the person you referred gets successfully placed on a future gig, we’ll deposit $500 into your Topcoder account.

See our [Gig Referral Page](https://www.topcoder.com/community/gig-referral) for  full referral program rules

name: Lab45 LLM Expert Hackathon - Bangalore Recruitment Challenge
description:
Welcome to the Lab45 Hackathon Challenge!  Lab45 is inviting exceptional LLM experts to join Wipro's Lab45 team.  Compete on this challenge to win prizes, an invitation to meet Lab45 team in Bangalore, and consideration for full-time employment!

Note - This is a job recruitment challenge.  If you’d like to compete on this problem but you’re NOT interested in full-time employment, we have you covered.  Just jump on over to the Topcoder challenge on the same subject, [here](https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/0c777150-1c3a-401e-b231-0b4021ae3b05).

**What is Lab45?**

Lab45 is a visionary space developing ground-breaking solutions to foster and accelerate ideation throughout Wipro.

At Lab45, teams of engineers, research analysts and scientists come together to infuse creative ways of incubating solutions for customers that will transform the future. It is a space filled with ambition at the vanguard of far-reaching research across cutting-edge technologies.

Established with the Silicon Valley culture of free-flowing creativity, Lab45’s goal is to make bold ideas reality and to invent the future of enterprise.


**Who can participate**
* **You are based in or willing to relocate to Bangalore.**
* You are enthusiastic to explore career opportunities with Lab45 team in Wipro.
* You have at least 2 years of coding experience and have successfully completed your Batchelor's degree.
* If you are a Wipro employee or Topcoder community member, or any external member, you meet the above criteria, and:
* Wipro Employees: Only those who are eligible for Internal Job Postings (IJP) or those on the bench can participate.
* Minimum Qualification: **Graduate**


**Top 20 Winners' Prize distribution at Wipro Office, Bangalore**
* There will be a celebratory event at the Wipro Sarjapur Office in Bangalore, organized to honor the top 20 winners of the Lab45 Hackathon Challenge.
* Winner certificate distribution place and date: Wipro Kodathi Office, Bangalore, 4th May 2024.
* Prize money will be distributed online, post the celebration event via the Topcoder platform.
* There will be a scheduled technical interviews (one or two rounds) during this event.
* If a participant cannot attend in person for the event, then there will be a scheduled telephonic or virtual interviews for the eligible participant.


**Event Details:**
* An introduction to Lab45, offering insights into its cutting-edge projects.
* A discussion on potential career opportunities within Lab45.
* A chance to network with fellow winners, Lab45 leaders, and industry experts.


**Eligibility:** 
* Eligibility for prize money is strictly limited to participants who meet the “Who can participate” criteria above. Failure to comply will result in disqualification from receiving any monetary rewards.
* Wipro employees must register for the challenge using their official Wipro email address to be eligible for the prize money disbursed through payroll.
* Winner certificate will be awarded at the Wipro Kodathi Office event.  You must attend to receive your prize money.
* If a participant is interested in pursuing career opportunities with Wipro's Lab45 team, but cannot attend in person for the event, and otherwise meets the eligibility requirements above, an online transfer of  the prize money can be organized.
* If you are not eligible to win awards on this Challenge, you can consider the [Topcoder Member Challenge](https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/0c777150-1c3a-401e-b231-0b4021ae3b05) instead.
* You may compete on either this challenge or the Topcoder Member Challenge, but not both.


## Challenge Background
Generative AI significantly improves workplace efficiency through advanced data analysis techniques. This challenge focuses on using Large Language Models (LLMs) to interpret tabular data, providing clear and meaningful conclusions.


## Challenge Objective and Instructions
You must develop an LLM-based solution that can answer questions about events.  Specifically, develop an LLM-based solution that:

* Ingests tabular data from a CSV file that will be provided when the Submission phase begins.
* The file includes the data you will need, along with every question you will be asked.  For a small number of questions, answers are also provided. 
* For each question posed in the data file, compute a natural language answer based on the information provided with the question.  There is one question per row in the file.
* Record your answer to the solutions.csv for provisional testing and final-solution.csv file for final testing for every question, and make sure your answer corresponds to the correct question.

**Key Constraints:**

* Solutions can use commercial LLM APIs (e.g., OpenAI, VertexAI, AWS Falcon).Topcoder holds a license for OpenAI.
* Solutions can also be based on publicly available LLMs.
* The challenge focuses on zero-shot learning; no specific training data will be provided.
* Contestants are not allowed to use LLM based APIs which have functionality which is customized for tabular data understanding example - LlamaParse (https://github.com/run-llama/llama_parse).
* Contestants are expected to build the tabular data understanding grounds up based on a single LLM.

**Note:** 
* Challenge Submission Start Date : **10th April, 2024**
* Challenge Submission End Date : **15th April, 2024**
* The provisional test data will be made available to the participants, once the challenge is open for submissions and the hold back test data will be made available, a day before the challenge ends in forums


## Evaluation

This challenge offers provisional and final testing rounds. Submissions will be evaluated on performance, technical merits, and documentation.
Performance will be  measured using [BERTScore](https://huggingface.co/spaces/evaluate-metric/bertscore), an ML-based metric designed to assess the quality of responses to questions.

**Provisional Testing:**  
* Provisional test data and queries will be shared in the forums at the start the submission phase.
* Contestants must submit their solution.csv file (see below for instructions) during the submission phase. 
* Topcoder will assign a Provisional Score to your submission by computing the average of the BERTScore calculations for each response.  
* The leaderboard will be updated periodically with your score.
* Code will not be evaluated during the Provisional round/submission period.

**Final Testing**: 
* Hold-back test data and queries will be shared in forums 24 hours before the submission phase ends.
* The final submission package has to include responses for this hold-back test data in the final-solution.csv file.
* Topcoder will make one attempt to run your code.  If your code doesn’t run, your submission will be disqualified.  Topcoder may but is not required to ask you for clarifications while running your code.
* Final scores will be calculated as Score = 0.7*( BERTScore Average) + 0.3*(Code Quality and Documentation).
* Scores will be ranked from highest to lowest to determine prize positions.


## Submission

**This challenge uses the code submission style. Your submission must include the following items.**
* The codebase for the solution:
* A video showcasing the setup and results of the first five questions in the hold-back test data. If the submission zip file including video is greater than 250 MB, upload it as an Unlisted video on YouTube and include the link in your documentation file.
* A deployment instruction about how to install required libs and how to run.
* A Docker file must be included for easy deployment.
* A starter bash script that we can boot up the service from the command line easily.
* Clear inline comments are strongly recommended for the key steps.
* A report about your solution, including the chosen LLM, architecture, etc.


**The final submission zip file should be in below format.**
```
submission.zip
....code/
........[YOUR CODEBASE HERE]
....solution/
........solution.csv
........final-solution.csv
....documentation/ (Hold-back test data execution video and solution report in pdf format)
```


## General Notes

* This challenge is not rated.
* Teaming is not permitted.
* Use the match forum to ask general questions or report problems, but please do not post comments and questions that reveal information about the problem itself or possible solution techniques.
* In this match you may use any programming language and libraries, provided Topcoder is able to run it free of any charge. You may also use any open-source languages and libraries, with the restrictions listed in the next section below. If your solution requires licenses, you must have these licenses and be able to legally install them in a testing VM etc.
* Prior to submission, please make absolutely sure your submission can be run by Topcoder free of cost, and with all necessary licenses pre-installed in your solution. Topcoder is not required to contact submitters.
* You may use open source languages and libraries provided they are equally free for your use, use by another competitor, or use by the client.
* If your solution includes licensed elements (software, data, programming language, etc) make sure that all such elements are covered by licenses that explicitly allow commercial use.
* If your solution includes licensed software (e.g. commercial software, open source software, etc), you must include the full license agreements with your submission. Include your licenses in a folder labeled “Licenses”. Within the same folder, include a text file labeled “README” that explains the purpose of each licensed software package as it is used in your solution.

name: New Platform Challenge - Sand Compactibility Prediction and Correlation
description:
This is a New Platform Challenge

The next evolution of Topcoder’s platform (formerly TopCrowd) allows companies to quickly create challenges and launch them directly to the Topcoder community, providing an additional way for you to compete and earn money. To participate, click the link below and log in using your Topcoder credentials. You will register and submit your solution from the Challenge Details screen. The company that launched the challenge will review all solutions and choose prize winners, which will appear in the new platform and here in the challenge feed.


Go to the Challenge!

Challenge Overview



This challenge will investigate a given data set related to sand used in the casting process. The sand has a "compactibility" value that is targeted, and an actual value is calculated. The deviation between the actual value and the targeted value is a key indicator of failures of the casting process.

We want to see if we can accurately predict compactibility deviations +-3 from the target, and document correlations from the other data columns that impact that prediction.

name: Innovation Series - Challenge 2: IntelliForm Bot
description:
# Challenge Background

Complicated paper-based and digital forms for all sorts of activities are a reality of modern life. Whether a person wants to do something, apply for something, submit something, or some other activity – complicated forms greet a person at almost every milestone. Most countries require forms for birth certificates. Then there are forms for school enrollment and college applications. Later, there are forms for government and commercial loans and grants, and weddings too. In addition, there are forms for medical and insurance benefits. Travelling requires forms, for driver licenses, passports, customs, etc. Want to avoid jail? You had better complete those tax forms!

Many of the problems people encounter with the benefits and processes behind all these forms stem from the information overload they can sometimes present coupled with simply completing them correctly. People who don’t frequently interact with bureaucratic details sometimes struggle to complete forms that are necessary for retirement, disability, and prescription drug benefits. Unfortunately, this also means that there are thousands of people every year who miss out on important benefits, even when they’re otherwise eligible.

Wouldn’t it be nice if AI could help people complete these forms?

In this challenge, contestants will come to the rescue of the form-filling public everywhere by developing a bot for helping complete any form.

name: IntelliForm Data Generator 1 - 1040EZ
description:
### Challenge Objectives

Create a CLI tool to fill in predefined pdf form document with randomized data

### Project Background

- Using AI to build a tool to fill in forms 

### Technology Stack

* Python or Java
* If you’re using Python, take a look at fillpdf library

### Requirements

Build a cli tool that will fill in [this PDF form (1040EZ)](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-prior/f1040ez--2016.pdf) 500 times with different data, based on these rules:
- First, last name, address, phone, SSN, routing/account number, occupation should be valid but random values (you can use [Faker](https://faker.readthedocs.io/en/master/providers.html) for this purpose)
- Numerical values in the form should be random values within ranges below, but calculated numerical fields should still be populated based on instructions in the form (straightforward calculations, add or deduct a couple of values). Ranges:
	- Wages - [1000 - 100.000]
	- Taxable interest - [0 - 1500]
	- Unemployment compensation - [0 - 10000]
	- Tax withheld - [0-10.000]
	- EIC - [0-2.000]
	- Health care - [0-1.000]
		- Calculate tax for line #10 as 10% of line 6
- Do not fill in spouse details, foreign country details, or change any checkbox values (see sample file)

Sample filled in form is attached (only the first page is relevant).

Apart from filling in the documents, tool should create a csv file with the values of the filled in attributes. Csv file should have the following columns:
File_name, first_name, last_name, ssn, address, address_2, apt_no, wages, interest, unemployment_compensation, gross_income, deduction, taxable_income, tax_witheld, eic, total_payments, tax, health_care, total_tax, refund, routing_number, account_number, owed, occupation, phone_number 

### What To Submit

- Code
- Generated filled forms
- Csv file

name: Fun Challenge: Experience the Web3 with Fujitsu Research Portal
description:
# Challenge Overview
## 1. Overview
Welcome to the "Experience the Web3” fun challenge, sponsored by Fujitsu and TC3! 

We're delighted to invite Topcoder members to take part in the [Fujitsu Research Portal](https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/) — an innovative platform that grants access to Fujitsu's cutting-edge Web3 and AI technologies.   
The purpose of this challenge is to provide you with a hands-on experience with the Fujitsu Research Portal. We are pleased to offer you the opportunity to explore it.

In this challenge, you can try out issuing NFTs easily using the Fujitsu ConnectionChain by following the step-by-step guide.  
Fujitsu ConnectionChain is a blockchain technology that can be accessed from the Fujitsu Research Portal.

This challenge is a successor of our [previous challenge](https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/275bda14-9fc4-4a03-9f02-7a9ceb1f5fcc?tab=details) which was a great success, and we are deeply grateful for the enthusiastic participation of all who joined.   
In addition to this challenge, we are eagerly anticipating the upcoming LLM-related challenge “Development of Generative AI Moderator for Trusted Web3 Community”. It is scheduled to start in the middle of March.  
[Stay tuned for the updates!](https://join.topcoder.com/fujitsu)

Fujitsu remains committed to fostering an ecosystem of collaboration and innovation within the realms of Web3 and AI.

**Important Notes:**  
Please note that participation may be subject to certain geographic restrictions, detailed further below in this document.

Have fun!

## 2. Background
### 2.1. Fujitsu stands with Web3 and AI
The World Economic Forum's Annual Meeting 2023 theme "[Cooperation in a Fragmented World](https://www.weforum.org/press/2023/01/cooperation-in-a-fragmented-world-addressing-pressing-crises-tackling-future-challenges/)" drew attention as a sign of the transition to a decentralized structure. In response to these changes, Fujitsu has developed multiple Web3 (blockchain) based products.  
Furthermore, we believe that the evolution of Web3 and AI can help to address the negative aspects that have been brought by ICT technology and play a key role in the creation of a new social economy.   

Fujitsu is a strong advocate for open innovation with a history of commitment to the concept.
In the Web3 and AI field, Fujitsu provides 2 platforms to accelerate open innovation: the “Fujitsu Research Portal” and “Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform”.
### 2.2. Have fun with the Fujitsu Research Portal!
The [Fujitsu Research Portal](https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/) is an environment that gives users the ability to quickly test Fujitsu’s technologies by providing APIs and web applications of tech components for free.  

You will use ConnectionChain, one of the blockchain technologies provided by the Fujitsu Research Portal through this challenge.•	You will use ConnectionChain, one of the blockchain technologies provided by the Fujitsu Research Portal through this challenge.  
ConnectionChain is an extension of smart contract technology that enables the automatic execution of a single-consistent transaction by connecting multiple blockchains.  
In this challenge, you are expected to execute a simple smart contract via ConnectionChain that issues an NFT on a single blockchain following a step-by-step guide.

In addition to this challenge, we hope you will find the technologies and resources available on the Fujitsu Research Portal to be valuable for exploring your ideas. 
We also welcome your feedback on the Fujitsu Research Portal so that we can continue to improve it.

Let's start having fun with the Fujitsu Research Portal!

# Task description
## 1. Expect in this challenge
* Join the [Fujitsu Research Portal](https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/) and experience issuing NFTs using the Fujitsu ConnectionChain by following the step-by-step guide.
  * The step by step guide will be available in this challenge forum at the start of the submission period.
* Submit the result of the NFT issuance.
## 2. Submission Guidelines
### 2.1. Contents
Submission should include:
* The API response message of ConnectionChain
* URL generated in the process.

Detailed definitions will be provided in the step-by-step guide.

### 2.2. Format
Must be a single zip archive that contains a single text file.

### 2.3. Note
You can issue multiple NFTs using ConnectionChain through this challenge and submit multiple results, but ONLY your first valid submission to this challenge will be used to determine winners.

## 3. Restrictions
* Fujitsu Research Portal is subject to its [terms of use](https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/content/terms-of-use-2024011901.pdf).
    * The user of the Fujitsu Research Portal must reside in the following areas:
        * Japan
        * UK (the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland)
        * EEA (EU countries and also Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein)
        * US (the United States of America) 
        * Oceania (Australia and New Zealand) 
        * ASEAN (Republic of Singapore, Republic of the Philippines and Malaysia) 
        * State of Israel 
        * India (Republic of India) 
        * China (People's Republic of China)
        * Canada 
        * Republic of Korea
        * Swiss Confederation 
        * Taiwan 
        * Hong Kong SAR
        * Indonesia (From Feb 8th 2024)
        * Thailand (From Feb 8th 2024)
        * Vietnam (From Feb 8th 2024)
* Due to the terms of use of the Fujitsu Research Portal, only users who reside in the regions allowed in the above-mentioned list are eligible to win the prize.
* Prize eligibility will also be based on the registered residential address within a participant's Topcoder profile.

## 4. References
### 4.1. Fujitsu ConnectionChain
ConnectionChain is a technology that allows securely linking different blockchains.  
Two or more independently operated blockchain systems (For example, blockchain for money flow management and commercial flow management) are connected through cooperative nodes.  
The central blockchain can then act as a Hub to manage the logic and execution trail of the collaboration.  
![image.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/92w3YrhpQLOK94RgJuUC)

* https://www.fujitsu.com/global/about/research/technology/connectionchain/index.html
* https://en-portal.research.global.fujitsu.com/content/connectionchain-scenario-script-reference-v1.1.pdf

### 4.2. Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform
Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform is a development environment as well as various service APIs based on blockchain and digital trust technologies.  
Fujitsu will provide access to the platform free of charge to select participants of its global partner program, "Fujitsu Accelerator Program " to drive co-creation of new Web3 services.  
![image.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Lf8YaKbGRaKlKICaxVwI)

The platform will contribute to the realization of a rich ecosystem that empowers users to create new applications for Web3, allowing for new ways to interact, create, and share data freely and securely for use cases including digital content rights management, contracts, business transactions and processes.
![resized_1.8.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/H1feBHqcTjClTxnEjAsT)

* https://www2.fujitsu.com/global/web3-acceleration-pf/
* https://www.fujitsu.com/global/about/resources/news/press-releases/2023/0206-01.html

# Judging Criteria
* The first 30 members who successfully complete the process (based on submission time) AND reside in the listed regions will win $50 each.  
* A submission is considered successful if the NFT can be verified by the reviewer.  
* Submissions from members not in the listed regions are not eligible for a prize and will be ignored.
