discussions.name: Exploratory Testing Challenge for eSW Website - 02 Discussion

description:
This challenge will have 24hrs for the registration (during this phase no one will see details) and 96hrs for bug hunting. Details will be posted on Sept 25th, 09:00 IST.

**CHALLENGE OBJECTIVES**

* Exploratory or unstructured testing and reporting
* UI, Functionality Testing are in scope

**ABOUT THE APPLICATION**

Be Connected is an Australian government initiative committed to increasing the confidence, skills and online safety of older Australians. Be Connected aims to empower everyone to use the internet and everyday technology to thrive in our digital world.

**BROWSER REQUIREMENTS:**

* **Desktop and Laptops**: Latest versions of Chrome, Microsoft Edge, Safari, and Firefox Browsers (Mac & Windows). 
* **Mobile Responsive Layout**: In scope
* **Tablet Responsive Layout**: In scope

**ATTACHMENT REQUIREMENT:**

You MUST attach images and videos to the ticket as their original file type, NOT as zip files.  
Images are preferred over videos - don't use a video to replace something that could easily be a screenshot. But for functional issues please attach a video

**CHALLENGE SCOPE:**

* Testing URL: **Will be posted when the competition starts in the form**
* UI, Functionality, Security Testing, Accessibility (If the issue is common for the site, we will accept only the first bug) are in scope
* You can register using different user categories and explore the app. But if the same issue exists on all or more than one category please report one bug and list the categories in the bug Report
* We will be providing you a whitelisted email addresses, please use those addresses to register. When you assign an email from the list please put your handle infront of it so that everyone will know it is already taken. Also fill the password you have used. **TBA**
* Bugs that are not related to the testing site domain are *out of scope*

**DETAILED DESCRIPTION ABOUT THE SCOPE:**

* Test the Browse Content Functionality to ensure topics,courses and activities can be accessed and completed.
* Use the search functionality to search for content.
* Filter catalogue by subject type, content and level.
* General visual appearance of website elements and buttons/ styling
* Links work as intended when clicked .
* General site navigation including home page and menu navigatiopn
* Viewing articles and tips
* New User registration/ password resets
* Print the guides display in various languages and can be printed when required
* Test Activity
* Comments
* Footer links and Site map and Glossary
* General spelling and grammar
* UI display. i.e buttons , text etc are in alignment, positioned correctly.
* Basic website accessibility testing. E.g. tabbing via keyboard, using a screen reader to play content.
* Pagination and scrolling across the website.
* Searching for network partners
* when registering. ie, ensuring drop down menus work as intended
* Site map and Glossary
* Playing videos on the test environment. Note, only these course videos are enabled in Test.
 * https://beconnected.esafety.gov.au/topic-library/advanced-online-security/using-antivirus-software
 * https://beconnected.esafety.gov.au/topic-library/advanced-online-security/managing-passwords
 * https://beconnected.esafety.gov.au/topic-library/apple-iphone-getting-started/iphone-prepare-to-set-up
 * https://beconnected.esafety.gov.au/topic-library/apple-iphone-getting-started/iphone-set-up
* Basic performance testing. Example, pages load in a reasonable time.


**CHALLENGE GUIDELINES:**

1. As issues are identified they need to be logged on Gitlab, you can find the link to the Gitlab page in the forum once you register.
2. Issues must include clear descriptions, steps to reproduce and expected vs. actual results in order to be counted.
3. The first competitor to find an issue gets credit, duplicates will not be counted.
4. Reviewers will accept, reject or mark the issues as duplicate.
5. Please DO take a look at the reported bugs, duplicated bugs cost your work time and the reviewer's time.
6. The copilot, reviewers, and PM decide whether a bug is valid or not based on our knowledge about the pages.  There will be no appeals.
7. Please thoroughly test the pages and find all kinds of issues.
8. Functionality testing must be based on the common functionality, all bug reports based on your own assumptions will be rejected.  If you are unsure about something, please ask in the forum.
9. Our expectation from Members is that they will report bugs on different browsers/ platforms under the same ticket if they have means to test it. Members should not be creating separate tickets for the same repeating bugs for separate platforms/browsers. In such a case it's totally up to the copilot and reviewers whether to accept the bug or not.
10. You must not edit the bug report once created, so make sure you enter all the details at the time you create the issue, otherwise, your issue will be moved to the end of the queue. If you really need to edit an issue you must use the comments section (i.e. add a comment to describe any changes you want to make to the issue), and we'll decide whether the changes are major enough to move the issue to the end of the queue. You are allowed to add screenshots in the comments section though, assuming your issue report contains all the details when created.

**ISSUE REPORTING GUIDELINES**

For each report of a bug, we need the following information:

- Please use this Self Registration to access to the repo: https://x.topcoder.com/api/v1/gitlab/groups/registration/138d78d8-a2d5-4bfa-8b5d-f3518a55274b-1695566726586
- Where to Report Bugs: https://gitlab.com/topcoder-consulting/esaftey-australia/esafety-be-connected/-/issues
- You need to assign at least one label from each category below 
				- Functional, Security, UI, Perfomance, Accessibility
				- Mobile, Tablet
				- Chrome, Edge, Firefox, Safari
				- Mac, Windows
				- **Category**: New Registration, Guest user, Authenitcated user, Edit profile, Topic, Course, Activity, Search function, Podcast, Article and tip, Newletter, Games and practice, Links, System, Navigation, Spelling and grammar

* **Summary**
* **Current URL** Copy paste the URL from the Address Bar where the issue is
* **Permission to log in** (User Account, Password used to test the application)
* **Steps to reproduce**, including any needed information (Must list all the steps that need to reproduce the bug, DON'T list only the bug without test data)
* **Actual results** - Current results before the bug is fixed
* **Expected results** - Expected results, after the bug, is fixed
* **Screenshot/Videos** - Attach screenshots, videos directly on GitLab (Do not use services like www.screencast.com or https://monosnap.com. Don’t use www.youtube.com to host the videos and don't upload zip file) & Crash - Console/Crash Logs and sample payloads (request body / query) that will be helpful to understand the bug.
* **Priority** Critical, Major, Minor, Low

**Low**: Bug won’t result in any noticeable breakdown of the system
**Minor**: Results in some unexpected or undesired behavior, but not enough to disrupt system function
**Major**: Bug capable of collapsing large parts of the system
**Critical**: Bug capable of triggering complete system shutdown

* **OS and Browser version** - eg: Android 13, Chrome 114.0.5735.110 | Windows 11, Chrome 114.0.5735.110
* **Device** - eg: Apple iPhone 14 Pro, Laptop HP DV-0045x
* **Reproducibility**
 
*Important Note:*

* Please DO take a look at the reported bugs, duplicated bugs cost your work time and the reviewer's time.
* Missing or Incorrect details to ANY of the above fields will mark the bug report as INCOMPLETE. For example, Incorrect Steps, Missing Screenshot/Screencast, Incorrect Actual and Expected results etc.

**ISSUE WEIGHTS AND SCORING**

* Scoring will be based on the number of bugs by weight and the weight to your bugs. The copilot has the right to decide a severity at his discretion.
* Only verified issues will be counted. Duplicate issues will be closed and not counted. 
* Log issues according to the guidelines above issues that do not follow these guidelines may reject due to lack of information.
* For challenge scoring, the user with the most points from verified issues will be selected as the winner. If two users submit the same issue, the user that submitted the issue first will receive credit.
* Please focus on UI, functionality testing based on the requirements, all bug reports based on your own assumptions will be rejected.
* We have first and second place prizes. For others, we will be awarding the following prize money to **all competitors for accepted bugs up to $200**.

- **Functional:** $4 [8 Points]
- **Security:** $5 [10 Points]
- **Responsive Issues (Mobile and Tablets):** $2 [3 Points]
- **Accessibility:** $1 [1 Point]
- **UI:** $2 [2 Points]

Please note that we will reduce marks, if you report a duplicate bug, so be careful when you are reporting the bugs. Always look at the bug list before reporting.
- **Duplicate Bug:**  [-2 Point]

**IMPORTANT NOTICE**

* Follow the standard topcoder [Bug Hunt Rules](https://help.topcoder.com/hc/en-us/articles/115008845167-What-is-a-Bug-Hunt-).
* If you do not properly document your bug reports, they will likely be rejected due to lack of information or documentation.
* DON'T RE-OPEN the issues in the review phase and anyone who RE-OPENS a ticket will be disqualified from the challenge.
* You must not edit the bug report once created, so make sure you enter all the details at the time you create the issue, otherwise, your issue will be moved to the end of the queue. If you really need to edit an issue you must use the comments section for this (i.e. add a comment to describe any changes you want to make to the issue), and we'll decide whether the changes are major enough to move the issue to the end of the queue. You are allowed to add screenshots in the comments section though, assuming your issue report contains all the details when created.
* You must specify the test data you have used in the 'Reproduction Steps', All the issues will be marked as 'Incomplete', if the correct test data is not provided.
* Keep an eye on the issues being submitted by other participants to minimize the time you may be spending on duplicate efforts. Knowing what has already been reported will allow you to better focus your time on finding yet undiscovered issues.
* There will be no appeals phase. The decision of Copilot for validity and severity of each filled issue will be final.

**WHAT TO SUBMIT**

Submit all your bugs directly to GitLab. When you are done with your submissions please submit a .txt file using the “Submit” button before
the submission phase ends. In this file include:

* Your Topcoder handle (The one displayed in the top right corner near the Profile picture)
* Your GitLab handle used to raise the issues.
* A link to your issue list.

ALL THE SUBMISSIONS WITHOUT ABOVE INFORMATION WILL BE REJECTED AND WON’T BE PAID.

IMPORTANT: Submit the above details before the Submission Phase ends.

DON'T use any other link to create new issues OR submit as document, they won't count and won't be paid.
name: BC - Exploratory Testing Challenge

discussions.name: RUX - Oil Finder Revamp and Brand Update - Responsive Web Design Challenge Discussion

description:
### CHALLENGE SUMMARY

Welcome to the “**RUX - Oil Finder Revamp and Brand Update - Responsive Web Design Challenge!**”. In this RUX challenge, we need your creative solution to revamp and refresh the look of the existing Oil Finder to become mobile-friendly and intuitive, which would help users find products much more easily. 

  

### WHAT IS A RUX CHALLENGE?

The **RUX (Rapid User Experience)** challenge uses the same format as our famous **LUX Challenge,** except it is not "Live" at an event. The RUX Challenge Series allows you to showcase just how good your concept and user experience (UI/UX) design skills are to digital leaders from some of the world's largest companies.

  

RUX (Rapid User Experience) challenges are fast, fun, and have more chances for you to capture prize money!

  
**Note:** *You do not need RUX challenge experience to join this challenge. Just jump in and give it a try! Follow the challenge details and use the challenge forum to ask questions.*
name: RUX - Oil Finder Revamp and Brand Update - Responsive Web Design Challenge

discussions.name: MDX Site AI Automation Test Ideation Challenge Discussion

description:
#### CHALLENGE CONTEXT
You are responsible for coming up with an idea and POC to generate tests for a MDX project automatically using AI. 
#### TECHNOLOGY
- AI
- Next.js
- MDX


#### INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS
The following assets will be provided to you:
- Drupal site codebase
- MDX site codebase

The client has 75 small and large websites, and they are expecting a solution to auto generate the tests and reduce the testing efforts as much as possible.

You should propose an idea to use AI to generate the following tests for the project:
- Check the drupal site and the mdx site are similar, and list the discrepancies
- Selenium Tests for the mdx codebase
- Unit Tests for the mdx codebase

The proposed solution should go over the codebase and generate the tests automatically. We are not expecting tools like Github Copilot. 

Note that the provided project is very simple, your idea should be able to handle much more complicated projects. And you are welcome to suggest more ideas that use AI to cut down on the testing efforts.

#### Submission Deliverable
- POC codebase
- Clear explanation of the idea

description:
#### CHALLENGE CONTEXT
You are responsible for coming up with an idea and POC to convert drupal websites to MDX websites.
#### TECHNOLOGY
- Drupal 
- Next.js
- MDX


#### INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS
The following assets will be provided to you:
- A simple drupal website codebase
- A manually converted MDX site codebase for the drupal website above

The client has 75 small and large drupal websites, and they are expecting some auto conversion tools to convert them into MDX websites to reduce the efforts as much as possible. 

The auto conversion tool should be able to handle below items intelligently:
Extract the data and content from the drupal websites
Classify them and create corresponding react components and wire it all together in the MDX file

You need to come up with an idea for this auto conversion tool and create a POC to show how it works. It’s required to take advantage of AI for this task. 

Note that the provided sample website is very simple, your solution should work with large and complicated websites. You can suggest using  tools in the market or a custom solution blueprint can be provided, 
or a mix of both.


#### Submission Deliverable
- POC codebase
- Clear explanation of the idea
name: 96hours - Drupal Site to MDX Site Conversion with AI Ideation Challenge

discussions.name: RDM 14 - Host Challenge Discussion

description:
# RDM 14 Host Challenge

This is the RDM Host Challenge for RDM 14. Register here to be considered for the RDM round. Submit a text file with only your username on this challenge, so the system can register you to the round.

## Contest details

Duration:  September 9 2023, 07:00-15:00 UTC-4
Problem statement: https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/b7211749-bbf7-4b30-aa12-ea77ba52029f?tab=details

The problem link will be private until launch time, at which point it will be published.

## Overview
In this round, you are given three different development problems of increasing complexity: Easy, Medium and Hard.

You must complete your solution according to a given technical specification, that will be tested with automated testing scenarios for 
1) API functionality, or 
2) Web content and functionality. 

Docker is used, so you may use any languages, tools or technologies you want to solve the challenges.

Sample submissions may be obtained from [here](https://github.com/penatrix-tc/docker-web-demos).

## Rules, scoring

Once the problem pages are published at the official launch time, you may begin solving the problems. 

Scores are calculated for each submission according to the following equation

### Scoring formula


![](https://images.ctfassets.net/piwi0eufbb2g/qM4BYrfHOhb5XwrXIaDkp/9181ada736c6d385ecce1743a89eec22/Screenshot_2020-12-10_at_10.02.49_PM.png)


**Total points awarded =**

**TotalPassingTestCases**  is the total number of test cases your submission successfully passes 

**TotalTestCases** is the total number of test cases set for the problem 

**PassedTime** is the time elapsed between match start time and submission time in minutes. 

**TotalTime** is the total time allocated for coding all problems in minutes, and 

**MaxPoints** is the maximum points available for that problem.

### Other rules

You may reuse code, in fact we support reusable code through the sample submission repository.

You may not plagiarize code.

Do not submit any harmful or malicious code.


## Guidelines

Remember to read the whole problem set. Sometimes the problems are related and build on each other iteratively, and sometimes they are completely separate problems.

Keep in mind that scoring is dependent on time.

Check the repo for docker command instructions.

## Join us!

You can contribute additional sample submissions to the [repository](https://github.com/penatrix-tc/docker-web-demos) if you happen to use a different tech stack. All contributions are appreciated, and will be accepted if they function like they should and are clean enough code-wise.

If you want to contribute problem sets, problem testing help, automated tester coding skills, or anything else, please get in touch with us on the official RDM channel on the [Topcoder Discord](https://discord.com/invite/topcoder).
name: RDM 14 - Host Challenge

discussions.name: Marathon Match 148 Discussion

description:
## Important Links

-   [Submission-Review](https://submission-review.topcoder.com/) You can find your submissions *artifacts* here. Artifacts will contain output.txt's for both example test cases and provisional test cases with stdout/stderr and individual test case scores. 
-   [Other Details](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/marathon-processor-specification-and-scoring-terminology) For other details like Processing Server Specifications, Submission Queue, Example Test Cases Execution.

## Overview

You control **F** frogs that live on the beach along a river, represented as a **H**\***W** grid. All frogs begin on the beach (first row). The river has logs of various sizes flowing horizontally in different directions. Some of the logs contain coins. The value of a coin is *r*, where r is its row number (0-based). Each turn you can move zero or more frogs into their neighbouring cells (horizontally or vertically). If a frog lands on a coin then that coin is collected and held by the frog. Once a frog returns to the beach then the value of all the coins it is holding is added to your score. If a frog falls into the water then it losses all its coins and is returned to a random location on the beach. Frogs cannot jump on other frogs. A frog sitting on a log will move with the log. This also means that a frog will fall into the water if the log it is sitting on moves outside the grid. Your task is to collect as many points as possible in the **1000** turns of the simulation.


Here is an example solution for seed=12. The first yellow row is the beach, the cyan rows represent the river and the red arrows show the water flow direction in each row. The green circles are the frogs, the brown rectangles are the logs and the yellow stars are the coins. The number shown on a frog represents the value of the coins it is holding.

![seed12.gif](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/mjc1WBFTT66iFHx56UKR)

## Input and Output

Initially your code will receive as input the following values, each on a separate line:

-  **H**, the height of the grid. This includes the beach at row **0**.
-  **W**, the width of the grid.
-  **F**, the number of frogs.
-  **KL**, the maximum length of a log.
-  **KW**, the maximum gap length between logs.
-  **PC**, the probability that a log cell contains a coin.
-  **H-1** lines representing the flow direction of each row starting from row **1**, where >' means left to right and '<' means right to left. For example, '>' will move the cell (r, c) to (r, c+1), while '<' will move it to (r, c-1).

For the next **1000** turns the following happens:

- You will receive the following:
	- **H**\***W** lines representing the current state of the grid in row major order. Each cell will be one of the following: beach ('#'), water ('.'), log ('='), frog ('@') or coin ('o').
	- The elapsed time.
- Your solution needs to output the following:
	- Number of frogs to move.
	- A frog's move formatted as "r c dir" (without the quotes), where (r, c) is the 0-based location of the frog and dir is the direction of the move: left ('L'), up ('U'), right ('R') or down ('D').
- The tester will move your frogs. If a frog lands on a coin then the coin will be collected. If a frog returns to the beach then the value of all its coins will be added to your score.
- The tester will move all the logs and everything on them, including the coins and frogs sitting on them. If any of the frogs die (land on water or move out of bounds) during this process then they will lose all their coins and they will be returned to a random location on the beach.


## Scoring

The raw score is the total number of points you collected during the simulation. If your return was invalid, then your raw score on this test case will be -1. Possible reasons include:

- Moving frogs out of bounds or onto other frogs.
- Moving the same frog multiple times in one turn.
- Invalid move format.

If your raw score for a test case is negative then your normalized score for that test case is 0. Otherwise, your normalized score for each test case is YOUR/MAX, where YOUR is your raw score and MAX is the largest positive raw score currently obtained on this test case (considering only the last submission from each competitor). Finally, the sum of all your test scores is normalized to 100.

## Test Case Generation

Please look at the generate() method in the visualizer's source code for the exact details about test case generation. Each test case is generated as follows:

- The grid height **H** is chosen between **8** and **30**, inclusive.
- The grid width **W** is chosen between **8** and **30**, inclusive.
- The number of frogs **F** is chosen between **1** and **5**, inclusive.
- The maximum length of a log **KL** is chosen between **2** and **6**, inclusive.
- The maximum length of a gap between logs **KW** is chosen between **1** and **5**, inclusive.
- The coin probability **PC** is chosen between **0.2** and **0.6**, inclusive.
- Generate the **H**\***W** grid. The row directions are chosen at random in a way that there are no more than **3** consecutive rows going in the same direction. The length of each log is chosen between **1** and **KL**, inclusive. This is followed by a gap, whose length is chosen between **1** and **KW**, inclusive. This process is repeated until the entire grid is generated **1000** turns ahead. If a cell is a log then with probability **PC** a coin is added to it. Place **F** frogs randomly on the first row.
- All values are chosen uniformly at random.


## Notes

-   No frogs were harmed during the making of this problem :)
-   The time limit is **10** seconds per test case (this includes only the time spent in your code). The memory limit is **1024** megabytes.
-   The compilation time limit is **30** seconds.
-   There are **10** example test cases and **100** full submission (provisional) test cases. There will be **2000** test cases in the final testing.
-   The match is rated.

## Languages Supported

C#, Java, C++ and Python

## Submission Format

Your submission must be a single ZIP file not larger than 500 MB, with your source code only. 
Please Note: Please zip only the file. Do not put it inside a folder before zipping, you should directly zip the file.

Make sure you name your Source Code file as Frogs*.<appropriate extension>* 

### Sample Submissions

Here are example solutions for different languages, modified to be executed with the visualizer. You may modify and submit these example solutions:

-   Java Source Code - [Frogs.java.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/czs2NT6QQ1CB2eaq9fvn)
-   C++ Source Code - [Frogs.cpp.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/TqCxSdAS3SFkTG4F8rVw)
-   Python3.6 Source Code - [Frogs.py.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/gMUWG21JSb2ZSTBzEEB7)
-   C# Source Code - [Frogs.cs.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Gur1BKBXRq2r3I6h5iTJ)


## Tools

An offline tester is available below. You can use it to test/debug your solution locally. You can also check its source code for an exact implementation of test case generation and score calculation. You can also find links to useful information and sample solutions in several languages.

#### Downloads

- Visualizer Source - [Tester.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/fNuNqicnSPqvhC44jy2d)
- Visualizer Binary - [tester.jar.zip](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/jDopxjuzSLGJeenGs3j9)


#### Offline Tester / Visualizer

Your solution should interact with the tester/visualizer by reading data from standard input and writing data to standard output. 
  
To run the tester with your solution, you should run: 
  
**java -jar tester.jar -exec "<command>" -seed <seed>** 
  
Here, <command> is the command to execute your program, and <seed> is seed for test case generation. 
If your compiled solution is an executable file, the command will be the full path to it, for example, "C:\\TopCoder\\Frogs.exe" or "~/topcoder/Frogs". 
In case your compiled solution is to be run with the help of an interpreter, for example, if your program is in Java, the command will be something like "java -cp C:\\TopCoder Frogs". 
  
Additionally you can use the following options:

-   **\-seed** <seed> Sets the seed used for test case generation, default is seed 1.
-   **\-debug**. Print debug information.
-   **\-novis**. Turns off visualisation.
-   **\-showFinal**. Shows the final state of the grid after 1000 turns.
-   **\-pause**. Starts the visualizer in paused mode. See more information below.
-   **\-delay** <delay> Sets the delay (in milliseconds) between visualizing consecutive simulation steps, default is 500.
-   **\-H** <H> Sets a custom grid height.
-   **\-W** <W> Sets a custom grid width.
-   **\-F** <F> Sets a custom number of frogs.
-   **\-KL** <KL> Sets a custom maximum log length.
-   **\-KW** <KW> Sets a custom maximum water gap length.
-   **\-PC** <PC> Sets a custom coin probability.


The visualizer works in two modes. In regular mode, steps are visualized one after another with a delay specified with the -delay parameter. In paused mode, the next move will be visualized only when you press any key. The space key can be used to switch between regular and paused modes. The default starting mode is regular. You can use the -pause parameter to start in paused mode.
 
Marathon local testers have many useful options, including running a range of seeds with a single command, running more than one seed at time (multiple threads), controlling time limit, saving input/output/error and loading solution from a file. The usage of these options are described [here](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/marathon-local-tester-parameters).
name: Marathon Match 148

discussions.name: NASA HATTB Swift App - Collision Avoidance updates Discussion

description:
![NASA HATTB - Topcoder Challenge Details Banner.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/oXFKNucWS1OhWZtr5Z6Y)

### Challenge Objectives

*  This challenge will focus on some subtle bugs with the collision avoidance algorithm used in the application experiments, specifically the MAP task, where the user needs to ensure virtual ships avoid restricted areas and other ships.

### Project Background

HATTB (Human-Autonomy Teaming Task Battery) is intended to provide a simplified version of the real-world tasks performed by remote operators monitoring and controlling vehicles with varying levels of automation (a.k.a. pilots controlling drones). The primary use case for HATTB is a psychology researcher studying the performance of participants as they complete specific defined Scenarios. In the future, the application could be extended to many use cases outside of drone operation.

There are a number of tasks defined in the app currently, including:

* Legacy MATB task
* Search task
* MAP task 

Researchers will be able to setup experiments for various scenarios.

### Technology Stack

* [SwiftUI](https://developer.apple.com/xcode/swiftui/) 
* [Swift 5](https://swift.org)
* [Catalyst](https://developer.apple.com/mac-catalyst/) targeting iPadOS and macOS
* [SpriteKit](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/spritekit/) 
* [Multi-peer connectivity](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/multipeerconnectivity) 

Note that third party libraries / CocoaPods are **not** allowed unless they are approved by the client explicitly.  The goal is to not have to use any third party libraries in the final application.

### Functional overview

A functional overview document will be provided in the forum, in the "docs" folder of the provided code.  

### Code access

The existing code for the application will be available in Gitlab, and access will be granted through a link in the forum. 

## Challenge requirements

This challenge will fix a couple of issues that have been raised by the client.  The list is below, and Gitlab access can be achieved by requesting it in the forum.

* https://gitlab.com/topcoder-consulting/nois2-033-hattb/HATTB/-/issues/499
	* For this ticket, please ensure that you properly test *all* 9 levels of automation in the MAP task, ensuring that they continue to work as expected.  This is a huge focus of the client, so we want to ensure this is solid and works as expected for all configurations.
* https://gitlab.com/topcoder-consulting/nois2-033-hattb/HATTB/-/issues/489

![SCR-20230901-ovcz.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Xcr331vJRdyDpJVkIPnd)

### Orientation

Note that this app will run on both iPadOS and macOS.  Please ensure that the contents scale appropriately on both.

### Deployment guide and validation document

Please include an updated README.md that describes how to run the app.  This shouldn't change much from what's already there, but if any specific setup steps are required for testing or running the above steps, please make sure that's covered.

#### Validation
You must also provide a Validation.md document, with information about how to properly validate the fixes above.  No video is required.

**NOTE**:

For this challenge, please ensure that you properly test *all* 9 levels of automation in the MAP task, ensuring that they continue to work as expected.

### What To Submit

* Git patch against a recent commit in git (anything 8370f5f402c34f2d0688567d67225086e3111b97 or later)  **Make sure to test your patch file and document the commit the reviewers have to use!**
* Updated README.md
* Validation.md
name: NASA HATTB Swift App - Collision Avoidance updates

discussions.name: Re-inventing Consortium by Web3 DAO Technologies Discussion

description:
# Challenge Overview
## 1. Overview
Welcome to the ideation challenge sponsored by Fujitsu and TC3 !  

Fujitsu, the leading information and communication technology (ICT) company and TC3, an IT  consultancy company leveraging GIG economy are looking for innovative ideas that might potentially become the key components for the future ecosystem within the Web3, especially in DAO (decentralized autonomous organization) region. 
In this challenge, we are looking for new use case ideas, solutions, and high-level system designs using Web3 DAO technologies. We will be using consortium as an example scenario, and your idea should significantly expand and accelerate the consortium’s achievements. 
Looking forward to everyone’s participation scheduled to open on Aug 25.

**Rewarded checkpoint review is scheduled.**

Good Luck!

## 2.Background
### 2.1 Fujitsu stands with Web3
As [The World Economic Forum Annual Meeting 2023 theme was Cooperation in a Fragmented World](https://www.weforum.org/press/2023/01/cooperation-in-a-fragmented-world-addressing-pressing-crises-tackling-future-challenges/), it depicts the world entering the decentralized structure, not the centralized platform-driven world. In response to these shifts, Fujitsu has developed multiple Web3 (blockchain) based products and services as a cloud service, exemplified by Fujitsu Data e-TRUST.
ref: Fujitsu Data e-TRUST https://www.fujitsu.com/global/services/caas/data-e-trust/
![www.fujitsu.com_global_services_caas_data-e-trust_.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/5ZgKvt6GS7uLMBZZtDNb)

In addition, Fujitsu provides the Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform. This platform offers the API services for trust, blockchain, and the expertise for advanced computing technologies through co-creation activities.
ref. Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform https://www2.fujitsu.com/global/web3-acceleration-pf/
![www2.fujitsu.com_global_web3-acceleration-pf_.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/qAVGLxeATEmzFdNztsv5)

### 2.2 Innovating consortium using Web3 technology
Even before the concept of DAO was widely mentioned as now, there had been various decentralized activities.
A consortium is one of the types of organizations that has been driven by the decentralized approach. 
Many companies and organizations, and individuals have joined and contributed to consortiums. Consortium is an organization where members come together with their wisdom toward specific goals and missions and contribute to each other with trust based on company authority.
We believe that by applying Web3's vision, practices, and technologies to consortiums, we can significantly expand and accelerate the consortium’s social achievements. 

### 2.3 The Future Vision of Fujitsu and TC3
Our ambition is to design a society where individuals and companies bring their wisdom and trust each other to face challenges and continue to create value that is truly needed in the world autonomously.
Fujitsu intends to build the world's first mechanism to manage consortium activities using Web3 DAO technologies autonomously. We are excited to see novel, feasible, and beneficial ideas from the members of Topcoder who are actually working in the decentralized world!

## 3. Web3 DAO technology Description
In the context of this challenge, the following technologies are considered web3 DAO technology.
* Blockchain
* Smart Contract
* Decentralized Application

Furthermore, solutions using these technologies are considered web3 DAO technologies.

# Task description
## 1. Expected Submission
We expect use case ideas with the solution and high-level system designs using Web3 DAO technologies which significantly expand and accelerate the consortium’s achievements. 

The idea will be scored against the judging criteria that will be solely decided by the client judges.
We ask participants to submit a report (Microsoft Word or PDF document) including below points;
* **Problem Description:** You should describe a single or multiple, combined common problems in current consortiums that your solution will solve.
  * We have defined some problems in current consortiums (more details later), you can select problems from them
  * You can define problems not defined by us based on your own experiences and thoughts
* **Solution Description:** You should describe the solution to that above problem using Web3 technologies.
  * Use case (e.g. actor, activities, process, data flow) should be described
  * High-level architecture design should be described
  * Participants can propose modifications to the current form and implementation of consortiums
  * Web3 DAO technologies (described later) should be used as elements of your technical solutions
* **Expected Effects Description:** You should describe the positive outcomes, good future, and any beneficial aspects that would result from your solution

## 2. Checkpoint submission guidelines
In this challenge, we allow checkpoint submissions. In order to be eligible for a checkpoint prize you must submit to this challenge by Aug 29.
Any submissions timestamped before then will be eligible and considered in the running for a prize for both the checkpoint and final submission. After this time you will only be eligible for final submission prizes.
The advantages of submitting to the checkpoint phase will be to get client feedback on your ideas and the opportunity to receive one of the five $100 checkpoint prizes. We will give you feedback on checkpoint submission until Aug 29 either generally or individually. You are not required to submit for the checkpoint in order to submit for the final phase, but we highly encourage you to submit one in order for the client to give feedback if any.
In order to qualify for the checkpoint prizes you must submit to the final round.

### 2.1 Checkpoint submission
#### 2.1.1 Contents
Checkpoint submissions should include the following.
* Title
* Overview
  * Overview of problems
  * Overview of solutions

#### 2.1.2 Format

* Must be a single zip archive for submission
  * Describe a single idea in a single MS Word or PDF document
    * Every content should be contained in a single document
    * External assets can be attached but must be accessible without any authentication
    * 1- 2 pages are good enough
  * Package all files into a single zip archive for submission
* Must be written in English

### 2.2 Checkpoint review timeline
The checkpoint review process is currently scheduled to take 48 + 9 hours due to the challenge complexity and the number of judges.
Any schedule changes will be announced in the forums.
 For clarity, we will have 4 judges from Fujitsu and 2 judges from TC3. Judges are from both technical and business backgrounds.
* Due date
  * Aug 29 23:00 EDT
* Feedback 
  * Sep 1st 08:00 EDT

## 3. Final submission guidelines
### 3.1 Final submission
#### 3.1.1 Contents
Final submission should include the following.
* Title
* Overview
* Problem description
  * Solution description
  * Use case scenario
* Technical solution
  * High-level architecture should be described
* Expected Effects, Benefits, and Attractions

Optionally, final submission may include the following.
* Challenges to overcome in implementing the solution
* Uncertainties that should be resolved to implement the solution

Using diagrams is highly recommended.

#### 3.1.2 Format

* Must be a single zip archive for submission
  * Describe a single idea in a single MS Word or PDF document
    * Every content should be contained in a single document
    * External assets can be attached but must be accessible without any authentication
    * There is no maximum page limit for the document, but 4 - 6 pages are recommended
  * Package all files into a single zip archive for submission
* Must be written in English

### 3.2 Final review timeline
As similar as the checkpoint, the final review process is currently scheduled to take 48 + 12 hours. Judges will be the same as the checkpoint submissions.
For a detailed timeline, refer to this challenge description.

## 4. Submission and prize limitations

* You are allowed to submit multiple ideas within a single submission
* However, you are eligible to win a maximum of one prize at each checkpoint and final stage

# Problem description
## 1. Definition of consortium
A consortium is an association of two or more individuals, companies, organizations, or governments (or any combination of these entities) with the objective of participating in an everyday activity or pooling their resources for achieving a common goal.
Consortiums serve diverse purposes and manifest in various practical forms.
In the context of this challenge, you should consider consortiums that have the following implementations and forms.

* The consortium is formed to achieve objectives that are challenging for an individual or single company/organization to accomplish, or objectives that may not be effective even if achieved
  * Example of objectives
    * Resolving public or social issues
    * Standardization
* The consortium does not intend to gain its own financial profit
  * Also not intend to distribute profits to participants
* The consortium is composed of invited participants or evaluated volunteers
  * Not considering the participation of a general or unspecified multitude of individuals, companies, organizations
  * In practice, individuals affiliated with companies, organizations, and governments engage in activities under the permission of their respective affiliations
  * Individuals with exceptional knowledge and achievements can be invited
* Participants mainly contribute non-monetary resources to the consortium, essential for its activities
  * Specifically, participants provide expertise, labor, facilities, computational resources, and more
* The consortium does not engage in extensive fundraising and does not undertake activities involving fund management
  * Due to the presence of numerous participants, it is challenging to adequately raise and manage funds
* The consortium functions as a platform to coordinate activities undertaken by participants in order to achieve their objectives
* In pursuit of the consortium's objectives, the following activities are undertaken by participants
  * Research and define problems and challenges
  * Research and define solutions
  * Propose problems, challenges, and solutions
  * Implement solutions
  * Verify solutions
  * Propose verified solutions
  * Distribute solutions
* The consortium disseminates its outcomes to the general public
  * Participants do not possess exclusive rights to utilize the consortium's outcomes
* The consortium holds rights to its own outcomes


## 2. Consortium’s problems and challenges description

**You can refer detailed problems description.**
[Detailed problem description](https://drive.google.com/file/d/14LOLb0f6FbAZiJVVgy5MshqpJiAOvJmf/view?usp=drive_link)

**Problem analysis is also available on the Miro board.**
https://miro.com/app/board/uXjVMrVcP_w=/?moveToWidget=3458764562369949405&cot=14
![Re-inventing Consortium by Web3 DAO Technologies - Problem analysis (En).jpg](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/PqOs09ErSmCesJxkR2tC)

For the consortium to achieve greater success, it requires gathering more contributions from participants. To accomplish this, some several issues and challenges must be addressed, including the following.

### 2.1 In increasing participation
Greater participation may lead to greater success.
But there are several reasons why the expansion of participants in the consortium is not occurring.

* Heavy burden
* Rigorous evaluation
* Less attraction

### 2.2 Increasing contributions
Greater contribution may lead to greater success.
But in some cases, participants may hesitate to contribute much and even consider withdrawal.

* Heavy burden
* Less attraction
* Unfairness
* Low transparency
* Divergent alignment
* Nonfunctional consortium

## 3. Web3 DAO technology Description
In the context of this challenge, the following technologies are considered as Web3 DAO technology.
* Blockchain
* Smart Contract
* Decentralized Application

Furthermore, solutions using these technologies are considered Web3 DAO technologies as well.

## 4. Out of consideration
You do not need to consider the legality of tax regulations and corporate laws in any country regarding your idea.

## 5. Materials
### 5.1 Reference of consortiums
Various consortiums with similar forms and implementations to those addressed in this challenge operate globally. 
The following are few examples or consortium.
**These  example consortiums  do not necessarily imply the above  issues mentioned.**

#### 5.1.1 Gaia-X
https://gaia-x.eu/

#### 5.1.2 Hyperledger
https://www.hyperledger.org/

### 5.2 Use case sample
As an illustrative example, we introduce the concept of the DAO Portal.
The purpose of highlighting the DAO Portal is to provide participants with an example of a potential application and stimulate their creativity.
However, it's important to note that the intention is not limited to solutions similar to the DAO Portal. Participants are welcomed to propose ideas that diverge from this concept and offer entirely new perspectives.

Fujitsu is prototyping a web service called “DAO portal”.
DAO Portal is intended to provide functionality capable of activating a consortium, offering the ability to:
* Communication between participants
* Identify and visualize contributions of each participant
* Secure information sharing 

DAO Portal is implemented using Data e-TRUST.

![web3-g7-demo-app.azurewebsites.net_home (2).png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/0bnKbhWVRoaSQB66w8IF)

![web3-g7-demo-app.azurewebsites.net_home (1).png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Jnpsop4QqWmmFiSW17it)

### 5.3 Reference of Fujitsu Data e-TRUST
Data e-TRUST offers customers a set of APIs that enable secure and reliable data exchange and utilization between different services and between individual users and businesses.
Leveraging Fujitsu’s proprietary IDYX and CDL technologies, this service enables tamper-proof management of data trails, including the proof of origin, ownership, and authenticity of data. By granting trust to all online transactions involving data such as electronic documents and digital content,
Fujitsu’s Data e-TRUST supports customers in solving business and societal issues and ultimately contributes to realizing a sustainable society.

![Data e-Trust.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Z8uBNGwQirvIRG5hqAEw)

* IDYX: IDentitY eXchange is a technology that guarantees "Data sharing trust", which is to safely distribute digital IDs such as distributed attribute information.
* CDL: Chain Data Lineage is a technology that guarantees "Data own trust". Scalable ledger ensures end-to-end traceability of data and things.

https://www.fujitsu.com/global/services/caas/data-e-trust/

**You can refer function manual.**
[Function manual](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1POBQ-CrHpTihKqe0NJ-1NbCVNMb3HLpn/view?usp=sharing) 


## 5.4 Reference of Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Platform
Fujitsu Web3 Appceleration Partform is a developmental environment as well as various service APIs based on blockchain and high-performance computing technologies.
Fujitsu will provide access to the platform free of charge to select participants of its global partner program, "Fujitsu Accelerator Program for CaaS" to drive co-creation of new Web3 services.
https://www2.fujitsu.com/global/web3-acceleration-pf/
https://www.fujitsu.com/global/about/resources/news/press-releases/2023/0206-01.html

![202300206-01a_tcm100-7143442_tcm100-2750236-32.jpg](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/z4lNzkH5TAiHFBps2DZr)

The platform will contribute to the realization of a rich ecosystem that empowers users to create new applications for Web3, allowing for new ways to interact, create, and share data freely and securely for use cases including digital content rights management, contracts, business transactions and processes.

![202300206-01b_tcm100-7143444_tcm100-2750236-32.jpg](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/v6rnl5wMSD2adt48A45F)

The expansion of the Fujitsu Web3 Acceleration Palatform continues, and recently, connection chains have been developed and integrated into the platform.
"ConnectionChain,” which will be added to "Data e-TRUST," allows the "Extended Smart Contract" feature to function autonomously, enabling multiple external blockchains to operate as one integrated system.
https://www.fujitsu.com/global/about/resources/news/press-releases/2023/0615-02.html

![20230615-02a_tcm100-7280686_tcm100-2750236-32.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/Wb1ljhyRt2IJkNJU4lpL)

# Judging Criteria
## 1. Prerequisites: Utilization of Web3 DAO Technology
In this challenge, integrating  Web3 DAO technology into the proposed ideas is a prerequisite. 
Utilizing Web3 technology is mandatory, and you must  provide a detailed explanation regarding the implementation and applicability within the context of their idea's feasibility.

## 2. Novelty (30%)
This criterion assesses the extent to which the proposed problem formulation and solution exhibit novelty compared  to existing approaches. Consider the following points for evaluating the novelty of both the problem and the solution:
* How does the proposed problem formulation introduce new perspectives or facets distinct from existing challenges?
* Is the problem formulation aligned with unresolved issues ?
* How does the proposed solution deviate from conventional methods or pre-existing solutions?

## 3. Feasibility (35%)
To evaluate the feasibility aspects of the proposed ideas, we consider the following aspects and provide a score based on their presence and quality:
* Indication of Idea Feasibility:
  * Suggest the feasibility of the proposed idea in terms of technology
* System Architecture, Function Description, Sequence of Processes:
  * Break down the system architecture into components, detailing the function and role of each component
  * Use system diagrams or similar formats to illustrate the structure of the solution
  * Use flowcharts, activity diagrams, sequence diagrams, or similar formats to illustrate the sequence of processes
* Definition of Users and Business Flow:
  * Segment users clearly
  * Map out the business flow in use cases or scenarios, articulating user experiences

## 4. Benefit (35%)
To assess the beneficial aspects of the proposed idea, we consider the following aspects and provide a score based on their presence and quality:
* Specific Problem Solving:
  * The proposed idea should clearly define the specific problems it aims to address and provide detailed insights into the essence of these problems and their potential implications
* Clear Beneficiary Definition:
  * The proposal should distinctly identify the targeted user groups and stakeholders, differentiating them if applicable, and precisely depicting how these groups will benefit
* Clear Indication and Magnitude of Effects and Impacts:
  * The anticipated effects and impacts of the proposed idea should be defined, illustrating the benefits and transformations it will bring to beneficiaries and stakeholders
  * The magnitude of these effects and impacts will be evaluated, considering both quantitative and qualitative dimensions

## 5. Incorporating Data e-TRUST (up to 20% extra score)
Ideas that incorporate the use of Data e-TRUST have the opportunity to earn an additional score of up to 20%. It's important to note that these bonus points will be granted specifically for effectively utilizing the functionalities of Data e-TRUST. 
This reward will only be applicable when the use of Data e-TRUST enhances the idea's feasibility and impact.

Furthermore, we encourage ideas that leverage Data e-TRUST to suggest modifications that improve its features or address specific challenges. 
The reward for these proposals will only apply when they demonstrate a clear understanding of Data e-TRUST's potential and its practical application to enhance overall outcomes.

This evaluation criterion aims to acknowledge both the effective use of Data e-TRUST's existing functionalities and the introduction of novel concepts that contribute to its continuous enhancement.
name: Re-inventing Consortium by Web3 DAO Technologies

# ePost RX Modernisation - P_DEMOGRAPHIC_MESSAGE_CHECK Test Case Write and Execution
<mark>**IMPORTANT: Do not share any code or document to public repository!!!!!!!**</mark>

# Challenge Objectives
Migrate existing data layer logic which is in form of stored procedures into application layer code.

# Project Background
This is the 11th challenge from the series of many challenges, where we are aiming at the application modernization.

The first step in this process is to migrate existing heavy data layer logic which is in form of stored procedures into the modularised application codebase.

Expose the implementation through the Java library.

In this QA challenge, we want to get the test scenarios to guarantee the accuracy of the conversion.

# Individual Requirements
**1. SCOPE**
- P_DEMOGRAPHIC_MESSAGE_CHECK
- DemographicMessageCheckService: Deploy the application locally, then you can see we have a demo contains endpoints there. Feel free to run your test case against it.

**2. DETAIL REQUIREMENT**
- Focus on test scenario cover all Error Messages and valid case.
- Provide test data using in each case.
- What we want is an end-to-end test case, don not split the stored procedure into pieces or update the stored procedure.
- **Run your test case against SP and generate a coverage report. Two sample usage has been uploaded to the forum, pls follow it.**

**3. Test Case Format**
Each test case must include the following info:
- Case Name
- Case Number
- Description
- Sample Test Data (if test data is required for the case)
- Expected Result
- Actual Result
- Test Result ( Pass, Fail or other status )

You may add additional fields if you feel they are necessary or improve the quality of your test cases. The assets for designs and details information are available in the forums. Feel free to ask in forum if you have any questions!

**4. Judging Criteria**
- Coverage: How completely test cases cover the functionality, the coverage should be greater than 90% at least.
- Maintainability: How well written and easy to understand the test cases are
- Content: How accurate the test cases are
- Quality: Overall quality of the submission


# Submission Guidelines
Your submission file must be in .xlsx format. Your submission must include written test cases, covering the functionality of above module Zip your test case document and submit it

description:
![NASA HATTB - Topcoder Challenge Details Banner.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/oXFKNucWS1OhWZtr5Z6Y)

### Challenge Objectives

*  SwiftUI / Swift 5 iOS app development targeting [Catalyst](https://developer.apple.com/mac-catalyst/) (iPad and macOS)
*  This challenge will fix some bugs that have been found in the version 1 of the app, as well as ensure that the code runs on the latest macOS and iOS versions.

### Project Background

HATTB (Human-Autonomy Teaming Task Battery) is intended to provide a simplified version of the real-world tasks performed by remote operators monitoring and controlling vehicles with varying levels of automation (a.k.a. pilots controlling drones). The primary use case for HATTB is a psychology researcher studying the performance of participants as they complete specific defined Scenarios. In the future, the application could be extended to many use cases outside of drone operation.

There are a number of tasks defined in the app currently, including:

* Legacy MATB task
* Search task
* MAP task 

Researchers will be able to setup experiments for various scenarios.

### Technology Stack

* [SwiftUI](https://developer.apple.com/xcode/swiftui/) 
* [Swift 5](https://swift.org)
* [Catalyst](https://developer.apple.com/mac-catalyst/) targeting iPadOS and macOS
* [SpriteKit](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/spritekit/) 
* [Multi-peer connectivity](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/multipeerconnectivity) 

Note that third party libraries / CocoaPods are **not** allowed unless they are approved by the client explicitly.  The goal is to not have to use any third party libraries in the final application.

### Functional overview

A functional overview document will be provided in the forum, in the "docs" folder of the provided code.  

### Code access

The existing code for the application will be available in Gitlab, and access will be granted through a link in the forum. 

## Challenge requirements

This challenge will fix a couple of issues that have been raised by the client.  The list is below, and Gitlab access can be achieved by requesting it in the forum.

* https://gitlab.com/topcoder-consulting/nois2-033-hattb/HATTB/-/issues/540
* https://gitlab.com/topcoder-consulting/nois2-033-hattb/HATTB/-/issues/538


### Orientation

Note that this app will run on both iPadOS and macOS.  Please ensure that the contents scale appropriately on both.

### Deployment guide and validation document

Please include an updated README.md that describes how to run the app.  This shouldn't change much from what's already there, but if any specific setup steps are required for testing or running the above steps, please make sure that's covered

#### Validation
You must also provide a Validation.md document, with information about how to properly validate the fixes above.  No video is required.

### What To Submit

* Git patch against a recent commit in git (anything 6423398242b66c16af8433c603d39d61612cf460 or later)  **Make sure to test your patch file and document the commit the reviewers have to use!**
* Updated README.md
* Validation.md

description:
# RDM Host Challenge

This is the RDM Host Challenge for RDM 13. Register here to be considered for the RDM round. Submit a text file with only your username on this challenge, so the system can register you to the round.

## Contest details

Duration:  August 19 2023, 07:00-15:00 UTC-4
Easy challenge (250 points): https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/bb971014-a3e3-4c78-b74e-48189109f35a
Medium challenge (500 points): https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/7139771b-aa70-4352-a0b0-133af8fc0f09
Hard challenge (750 points): https://www.topcoder.com/challenges/ad46643a-fcc4-4d35-8cc6-a93d5569933f

## Overview
In this round, you are given three different development problems of increasing complexity: Easy, Medium and Hard.

You must complete your solution according to a given technical specification, that will be tested with automated testing scenarios for 
1) API functionality, or 
2) Web content and functionality. 

Docker is used, so you may use any languages, tools or technologies you want to solve the challenges.

Sample submissions may be obtained from [here](https://github.com/penatrix-tc/docker-web-demos).

## Rules, scoring

Once the problem pages are published at the official launch time, you may begin solving the problems. 

Scores are calculated for each submission according to the following equation

### Scoring formula


![](https://images.ctfassets.net/piwi0eufbb2g/qM4BYrfHOhb5XwrXIaDkp/9181ada736c6d385ecce1743a89eec22/Screenshot_2020-12-10_at_10.02.49_PM.png)


**Total points awarded =**

**TotalPassingTestCases**  is the total number of test cases your submission successfully passes 

**TotalTestCases** is the total number of test cases set for the problem 

**PassedTime** is the time elapsed between match start time and submission time in minutes. 

**TotalTime** is the total time allocated for coding all problems in minutes, and 

**MaxPoints** is the maximum points available for that problem.

### Other rules

You may reuse code, in fact we support reusable code through the sample submission repository.

You may not plagiarize code.

Do not submit any harmful or malicious code.


## Guidelines

Remember to read the whole problem set. Sometimes the problems are related and build on each other iteratively, and sometimes they are completely separate problems.

Keep in mind that scoring is dependent on time.

Check the repo for docker command instructions.

## Join us!

You can contribute additional sample submissions to the [repository](https://github.com/penatrix-tc/docker-web-demos) if you happen to use a different tech stack. All contributions are appreciated, and will be accepted if they function like they should and are clean enough code-wise.

If you want to contribute problem sets, problem testing help, automated tester coding skills, or anything else, please get in touch with us on the official RDM channel on the [Topcoder Discord](https://discord.com/invite/topcoder).
name: RDM 13 - Host Challenge - Cody's Snake Game

discussions.name: HAQ Trend Analysis Prototype Challenge Discussion

description:
#### CHALLENGE CONTEXT
You are responsible to create a prototype for the provided wireframe.  

#### TECHNOLOGY
* Angular 11.0.3
* Typescript
* SCSS
* HTML5
* Libraries: Please only use well known libraries which are updated till date and easy to integrate.  Deprecated old libraries are not allowed. 


#### INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS
##### General Requirements
Browser Support: Latest Chrome, Edge, Firefox and Safari in Desktop

##### Prototype Requirements
You only need to implement the following page: 

Wireframe page 
![wireframe.png](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/RbZzd7a7T0mZsPrGDww3)


The following sections in the page above are in scope:

There is a global dropdown for all charts, and it has the following 4 options. 
* Functional Group
  * When it’s selected, show the top 5 functional groups (veevaFuncGroup) in the charts.
* Product Family
  * When it’s selected, show the top 5 product families (veevaProductFamily) in the charts.
* Modality
  * When it’s selected, show the top 5 modalities (haqModality) in the charts.
* Country
  * When it’s selected, show the top 5 countries (haqCountries) in the charts.
  
Trending Topics (Heatmap)
* This chart shows the trends for the clusters. Please note that the provided design is a recommendation. If you have alternative approaches for presenting the data, kindly suggest them for approval. 
* Hover the mouse over the cluster shows the tooltip.
* Field Mapping: (all values are dynamic)
  * Clusters - cluster_label 
    * Show the top 5 clusters
  * Cluster weight - the number of records
  * User can select (or unselect) one or more clusters. The charts below will then display data only from the selected clusters.  
  * The breadcrumb should also be updated to reflect the current selected clusters. 
  * Please list the associated records in the Topics component on the right too. 


HAQ Responded Questions Trend (Line Chart)
* This chart shows the data for the current selection. 
* Hover the mouse over the data point shows the tooltip.
* User can pan, zoom in/out the chart or select a region.  
* When user selects a region, the topics in the date range should be listed in the Topics component. 
* Field Mapping: (all values are dynamic)
  * X-axis value - haqSubDate
  * Y-axis value - the number of records
  
HAQ Responded Questions Distribution (Donut Chart, Bar Chart and World Map)
* This chart shows the data for the current selection. User can click the donut chart, bar chart and world map icons to switch among them. 
* Hover the mouse over the data point shows the tooltip.
* Field Mapping: (all values are dynamic)
  * chart value - the number of records
* For the world map, the data should always be grouped by the country.


Topics List
* This component just lists the associated records. 
  * List the records associated with the selected clusters in the Trending Topics chart.
  * List the records associated with the selected range in the line chart
* Place this component on the right of the page. 
* For each topic, render the topic_label field value. 

User can click the full screen icon in each chart to make the chart full screen, and click the restore icon to restore its state. 

And please create a functional component for each chart, so that they can be reused in other pages. And they should have inputs for the data too. 


#### Submission Deliverable
* Codebase
* Make sure there are no lint errors

discussions.name: Retirement Plan Advisory Application UI Design Challenge Discussion

description:
### TIMELINE UPDATE
Updated: 22 Aug, 2023 10:20AM EST

```
We extended the deadline until Sunday, 27 August, 2023 8:00AM EST.
```

  
### ROUND 1
**Submit your initial designs for checkpoint feedback**

* 1. Client Plans Landing Page
* 2.1 Plan Details - Design
* 3.1 Create report - Select Task 
* 3.2 Create report - Select Report 
* 3.3 Create report - Select Pages 

  
### ROUND 2
**Submit your final designs with all checkpoint feedback implemented**

* 1. Client Plans Landing Page
* 2.1 Plan Details - Overview
* 2.1 Plan Details - Contacts
* 2.1 Plan Details - Design
* 3.1 Create report - Select Task 
* 3.2 Create report - Select Report 
* 3.3 Create report - Select Pages 

  
### CHALLENGE DESCRIPTION

Welcome to the **Retirement Plan Advisory Application UI Design Challenge**.

The aim of this challenge is to redesign our client’s, Fiduciary Decisions’ existing SaaS application that is being provided for actors on the financial market. 

### CHALLENGE OBJECTIVES

* To create UI screens for a responsive web application in desktop format.
* To provide an intuitive, seamless flow to complete user goals.

### PROJECT OVERVIEW

* The current Retirement Plan Advisory application is data-heavy, unintuitive, and primarily designed by developers. This leads to complex navigation and ineffective dashboard use. The outcome of this engagement aims to overhaul the UX and UI design of the application to make it more intuitive and user-friendly for Retirement Plan Advisors. 
* The purpose of the application is for Retirement Plan Financial Advisors to manage the retirement plans, such as 401(k)s, that they advise employers on. The primary feature that the app provides is the generation of a benchmarking Report about a retirement plan that the advisor manages. The benchmarking reports analyze services provided versus fees. The project's final outcome is that a new UI should support the seamless generation and management of these reports.
* During an earlier update our client added a dashboard to the application, which resulted in users having to drill down to find certain functionalities, so they decided to remove the dashboard and would like to surface the more important rather tabular data along with the available actions. The client provided wireframes based on a usability study’s findings to solve the user issues.

### USER STORY

Jack is working at Acme company as a Retirement Plan Financial Advisor, he is managing retirement plans. He is provided with access to Fiduciary Decisions’ application that lets him create third party, independent benchmarking reports to be able to compare Acme’s fees and services to others’ in the industry on a specified market, so that he can show the value of Acme’s services. The reports are 5-15 pages pdfs that are being generated at the back end (not in scope). 

Jack logs in to the app with SSO (not in scope) and finds the list of client plans he manages. He can see already created reports associated with the plans and can initiate a new report as well from the list. He can also see any alerts regarding his plans in the list with possible actions. In addition, he can check the details of the plans.

### AUDIENCE  
* Retirement Plan Financial Advisors
* Record keepers

### SCREENS/FEATURES

Please make sure your design includes the following screens/sections. Our client is open to your suggestions about the structure of the screens as long as the screens deliver the same content and allow for the same functionality that is shown on the attached wireframes.

**General elements to be included** (check the wireframes as well): 

* **App header**: In the header there should be a link to the profile, global search, notifications, and settings.
* **Main navigation**: The main navigation has 4 elements as follows: Clients, Prospects, Tools, Dashboard. Please provide a solution for the attached navigation structure along with the subpages links (04 - Main navigation structure.png)
* **Footer**: Simple footer at the bottom.

**Screen requirements:**

  
**1. Client Plans Landing Page** (01.01 - Dashboard - List with hover.png)
When the user lands on this page they can see a list of client plans. They can import or add new plans here. This page has 3 tabs as well as default: Recent & Upcoming, All Plans, and My Plans. In addition, they can save additional views that will be added as new tabs. Functionality we need on the tab:

* **Quick Filters**: The tab has 3 default quick filters: Owner, Record Keeper, Advisory Firm. Show us how this quick filter looks like.
* **Advanced filters**: Clicking on this element shows a panel with additional filters, where dozens of fields can be managed.
* **Edit columns**: This function lets the user customize which columns and in what order they want to see. Please provide how the settings can be done. 
* **List of plans**: Check the wireframes for columns and content. The list records must have a hover state that enables the user to open the Plan Details or to create a new report (both in scope). 
* **Alerts**: There should be a way alerts regarding a record can be shown to the user along with a popup with certain features (01.02 - Dashboard - Alerts.png).
* **Help**: Help can be accessed for the header of the app and provides certain options we would like to see in your designs (01.03 - Dashboard - Help.png).
* **Search**: Please provide a design for a robust global search functionality shown on the wireframes (01.04 - Dashboard - Search.png).    

  
**2. Plan Details**
The Plan Details page has its own navigation to break up the large amount of information regarding a single plan. This navigation has to be clearly set aside from the main navigation. Please check the wireframes for content.

**2.1 - Overview** (02.01 - Plan details - Overview.png): In this section the user can see the main information about the plan, along with a list of the already created reports and a list of alerts and to-dos.
 
**2.2 - Contacts** (02.02 - Plan details - Contacts.png): This page contains a list of contacts associated with the plan. 

**2.3 - Design** (02.03 - Plan details - Design.png): This page shows more granular details, settings about the plan. Besides the settings the user can see tooltips and the possible options for the setting. Besides viewing, the user should be able to modify the settings.

  
**3. Create Report**
As the main function of this app the user starts to create a report here. They have to follow a couple of steps to set up their report. Please provide the following steps:

**3.1 - Select Task** (03.01 - Create Report - Select Case.png): The user first selects a task they want to achieve. You may want to explore if this step can be solved already on the plan list, e.g. from a dropdown of options or so.

**3.2 - Select Report** (03.02 - Create Report - Select Report 1.png, 03.02 - As the next step the user has to select one from a list of common and saved report templates. As you can see on the wireframe, there may be more available templates than what you see on that screen. Come up with a usable, intuitive solution for this.

**3.3 - Select Pages** (03.05 - Create Report - Configure Report.png): On this page the available pages of the selected report type are being offered to the user to mark as included or not included in the new report. Please provide an effective way of handling this task. After this step the report can be generated. Please provide the end of this flow.

### DEVICE SPECIFICATION	

Desktop - 1440 px width

### DESIGN GOALS & PRINCIPLES

* Easy to use interface that provides better discoverability of the important functions.
* The style should be suitable for an internal enterprise setting
* Branding should be considered	

### BRANDING GUIDELINES

* Branding information is shared on the challenge discussion forum.
* Client is open to your typography suggestions.

### JUDGMENT CRITERIA

* **Creativity**: Conservative; barely new ideas, use what is already proven to work.
* **Exploration**: Flexible; follow the provided screen requirements section and propose improvements or different paths that positively impact the user goals.
* **Aesthetics**: Hi-fidelity design; provide a top-notch finished looking visual design.
* **Branding**: Flexible; follow the provided guidelines and suggest improvements where seem appropriate and inline with the goals.

### DESIGN ASSETS
The below items have been attached in the challenge forum.

* Wireframes
* Branding information

### STOCK PHOTOS AND ICONS
* **Photos**: use only free photos from the [sites allowed by Topcoder](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/stock-artwork-font-and-icon-policies).
* **Icons**: use only icons that are free (based on [Topcoder icons policy](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/stock-artwork-font-and-icon-policies)) without giving attribution, or create the icons yourself. If the icons are not free, we will require them to be replaced in the final fixes.
* **Fonts**: use fonts as allowed by [Topcoder font policy](https://www.topcoder.com/thrive/articles/stock-artwork-font-and-icon-policies).

### MARVEL PROTOTYPE	
We use Marvelapp to showcase your design to our client.

* Ask for a Marvel project on the forum.
* Upload your screens to Marvel, and include hotspots so that the client can see the interactions between your screens

### FINAL DELIVERABLES
You have to submit a single zip file that includes the following 4 items:

**Source.zip**
* All original source files
* Create files in Figma, Sketch or Adobe XD.

**Submission.zip**
* Your screens exported as PNGs

**Declaration.txt**
* A text file that contains all the notes about font usage, photo and icon declarations and your Marvel project URL 

**Preview.jpg**
* Create a JPG preview file of 1024 x 1024 px

description:
# ePost RX Modernisation - P_DEMOGRAPHIC_MESSAGE_CHECK Implementation
<mark>**IMPORTANT: Do not share any code or document to public repository!!!!!!!**</mark>

# Challenge Objectives
Migrate existing data layer logic which is in form of stored procedures into application layer code.

# Project Background
This is the 11th challenge from the series of many challenges, where we are aiming at the application modernization.

The first step in this process is to migrate existing heavy data layer logic which is in form of stored procedures into the modularised application codebase.

Expose the implementation through the Java library.

# Technology Stack
- JDK 8
- Querydsl 5.0.0
- Junit v5
- MS SQL Server 2014 and 2019 ( Make sure your submission works on both versions )
- **Infinispan-core-5.2.11.Final-redhat-1**

# Individual Requirements
**1. SCOPE**

All the services list below inside com.humana.pharmacy.service are in scope.
- DemographicMessageCheckService

**2. GENERAL REQUIREMENT**
- Please be careful about using left join instead of inner join.
- Use existing service as much as possible, move redundant logic into common service.
- Unit tests are in scope and the coverage should >85%.
- Do not break any unit tests.
- Both positive and negative demo are required in demo showcase.
- Necessary document is required in class level and method level.
- Overall solution should not be tightly coupled with the MS SQL Server version
- **Confirm in forum if there are differences between the stored procedure and design (Basically, we should follow stored procedure)**
- **Encourage to improve the performance and migration accuracy, BUT DO NOT INTRODUCE COMPLEXITY**


# Submission Guidelines
Please submit a .zip file that includes:

- A text file includes your Gitlab handler and Merge Request address.
- All diff files against each repository.
name: ePost RX Modernisation - P_DEMOGRAPHIC_MESSAGE_CHECK Implementation

# ePost RX Modernisation - P_ANSWorkflowRuleContext Test Case Write and Execution
<mark>**IMPORTANT: Do not share any code or document to public repository!!!!!!!**</mark>

# Challenge Objectives
Migrate existing data layer logic which is in form of stored procedures into application layer code.

# Project Background
This is the 8th challenge from the series of many challenges, where we are aiming at the application modernization.

The first step in this process is to migrate existing heavy data layer logic which is in form of stored procedures into the modularised application codebase.

Expose the implementation through the Java library.

In this QA challenge, we want to get the test scenarios to guarantee the accuracy of the conversion.

# Individual Requirements
**1. SCOPE**
- P_ANSWORKFLOWRULECONTEXT
- AnsWorkflowRuleContextService: Deploy the application locally, then you can see we have a demo contains endpoints there. Feel free to run your test case against it.

**2. DETAIL REQUIREMENT**
- Focus on test scenario cover all Error Messages and valid case.
- Provide test data using in each case.
- What we want is an end-to-end test case, don not split the stored procedure into pieces or update the stored procedure.
- **Run your test case against SP and generate a coverage report. Two sample usage has been uploaded to the forum, pls follow it.**

**3. Test Case Format**
Each test case must include the following info:
- Case Name
- Case Number
- Description
- Sample Test Data (if test data is required for the case)
- Expected Result
- Actual Result
- Test Result ( Pass, Fail or other status )

You may add additional fields if you feel they are necessary or improve the quality of your test cases. The assets for designs and details information are available in the forums. Feel free to ask in forum if you have any questions!

**4. Judging Criteria**
- Coverage: How completely test cases cover the functionality, the coverage should be greater than 90% at least.
- Maintainability: How well written and easy to understand the test cases are
- Content: How accurate the test cases are
- Quality: Overall quality of the submission


# Submission Guidelines
Your submission file must be in .xlsx format. Your submission must include written test cases, covering the functionality of above module Zip your test case document and submit it
name: ePost RX Modernisation - P_ANSWorkflowRuleContext Test Case Write and Execution
